Reviews.Title: “Old, bad smell,”
Reviews.Author: Mfpgl
Reviews.Content: Thia hotel needs a renovation!!! Is very very old (my room smells cigaret and the carpet is terrible!! My lugagge taks 1:30 to go to my room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: dcp_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Easter weekend and were very happy with all elements of our stay. The check in process was carried out by a very friendly and polite guy, being we had executive rooms he offered to take us upstairs to check in at the executive lounge but we were happy to proceed as we were. The rooms we had were nice - having seen other reports we were worried about them being dated, but certainly on the executive floors they were clean and as expected for this standard of hotel. The bathrooms were small and had no separate shower but were acceptable with nice toiletries, the same we had in the Conrad Singapore on our last stay. The executive lounge was well stocked and again the staff were pleasant, it had a nice terrace you could sit out on with great views which made it extra special. Breakfast on the 14th floor was good and had a varied selection with all of it being good quality. This too had a terrace which was nice to sit out on and start the day. I would recommend this hotel everything was good but above all the staff were all so friendly it made the experience stand out. Only downfall I can think of is the location but even that is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - five star !”
Reviews.Author: fenixUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for three nights. Reception very efficient and welcoming. Rooms are a nice size with all facilities you would expect and housekeeping was perfect. The bar on the 14th floor has great views of the Bosporus - you must go up there. Breakfast was plentiful but very busy at peak times. Gym is small but sufficient for a quick work out. The area was a bit out of the way but fine for work. Meeting rooms were good and wifi worked ! I would be happy to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with no drawbacks for tourists other than location”
Reviews.Author: whystayhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two occasions as part of a tour. We were very pleased with the hotel, although the location was not convenient for Istanbul sites other than Ortakoy and the Dolmabache Palace, which were within walking distance. The room was spotless, the staff were pleasant and helpful, and breakfast was terrific. We also booked an additional night after the tour was over and paid $150 (not including breakfast) which was a real bargain for this property, so shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Njoki K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel at the end of March. Its located in close proximity to great historical attractions like the Dolmebahce palace in a nice part of town. The rooms were simple but clean and comfortable - I was on the 6th Floor. The staff was great, from the reception to room service and cleaning staff. I'd highly recommend having a drink at the Summit bar on the 14th Floor, the view of Istanbul from there is breathtaking especially at night.My only complaint would be the lingering smell of cigarette smoke in the corridors of the supposedly "non smoking rooms section". For getting around in Turkey, use the trams if you can. They get quite packed especially during the rush hour but they are 10 times cheaper than taxis and you avoid the Istanbul traffic jams.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Konsultants
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel at the end of March. The hotel is located near Dolmebahce palace, which itself is worth visit, but for the trip to Old town better use public tram (stop is 20 min walk from the hotel). Taxis could be stuck in traffic jams, which are present everyday, and, as one taxi driver put it - Istanbul good, traffic bad. :) If you would like to make everything on foot (or be on short holidays), then better stay in Old town (near Sultanahmet/Grand Bazaar). Breakfast in Conrad is very good, 14th floor bar and Club lounge on 15th floor, as well as gym facilities are excellent. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul from the top”
Reviews.Author: GVendryes Posted by a Prestigia traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent location that deserves its number of stars. Staff is welcoming and always ready to help. Rooms are unfortunately quite basic, but if you happen to spend time in the hotel while being in such a great city, recommendation is to go up to the Summit Bar - excellent anytime in the day, from breakfast to late night. The Business lounge though is quite small and very noisy...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this until it has been refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Onefourall
Reviews.Content: They were repairing the roof while we were there and didn't warn us at all for two days. Their information was never correct e.g " work wil not start before10.00am", but we would hear them hammering away at 8.00am. anyway. We were eventually moved to another suite a few floors down from the executuve floor but I would check the state of play before booking as they said they were about to start refurbishing the whole hotel and this will be a noisy two year project. It certainly needs it. The Turkish restaurant was closed while we were there and the other dining room on the ground floor was extremely depressing.Oh and their internet charges are outrageous, for 2 ipads & 2 laptops they suggested that we pay seventy pounds sterling a day. We got a different rate from everyone we asked so persist until you get the one that you think is fair, most of the other hotels in Istanul include this free with the room rate now. The executive bar on the 15th floor was a bit of a haven and has good views over the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge at Conrad Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: k14usmukh
Reviews.Content: Just wrapped up a long stay at Conrad ...very good experience ..must call out Nihat Kilic at the Concierge - absolutely wonderful and helpful - reach out for him if you are there next

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but..”
Reviews.Author: ViaGlobo
Reviews.Content: Conrad tries to impress with luxurious materials, but there are some flaws for the traveler with a focus on functional perfection. No power outlet on the desk, you have to crawl under it. No outlet for international plugs but concierge delivers one if needed. No separate shower, you stand in the bathtub. Installations are a bit dated, shower only works full power, american style. Toilet flush on the other hand tries to save water, meaning you may have to press it several times... Another issue: you definitely hear it if your neighbor takes a shower. Economy internet, included in my corporate rate, has a data limit! Be careful when composing a long email on a webmail server - all typing might be lost if you hit the limit while you work on it. The system just kicks you out. When will these big chains understand that web access is as important as running water for today's travelers? Reminds me of the old days, in cheap rooms in exotic places, where you throw a coin into a slot for hot water. If you shower too long, you wash you soap off with cold water (at least you can still wash it off). Conrad Istanbul is on a hill - you better be a good walker or you need to take a cab for everything. Next ATM, grocery store, coffee shop is about 10 min walk downhill and not very nice to walk. Staff was efficient but not overly friendly. Bottom line - I would not pick the place if it were not on a corporate contract.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with bad reception management”
Reviews.Author: ginola95
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a vacation with my wife, the hotel appearance form inside out is quite good, the reception employees have nothing to do with a 5 star hotel receptionist they seems lost (noting that Hhonor desk is used by any customer and there is not Hhonor), in-cooperative and tried to give us a different room than the one we already reserved at first by claiming there is no available room with our preferences and then they are trying to solve it, finally said they setteled the issue but before siging the check in application I discovered that nothing was as my reservation so I returned it to them and threatened to call HHonors in London to solve my problem as I am HHonor member at this moment another employee came to assist me (I discovered that she is the manager) who was already at the desk listening to all what was going on for more than 15 min. without interfering until she noticed that I will take a serious action towards them so she came and offered to help within no time everything was settled as per our reservation and we got our room. (I read many comments on trip advisor about the receptionists trials not to provide the reserved rooms as if to get rid of the bad location rooms first) The rooms in the hotel are divided in 3 categories one with Bosphour view another with the city view and the majorty which is the worth only view other rooms!! nice design but in wrong direction. Try to inisist to get a room on the bosphour view. Our room was on the bosphour view it was very nice and comfortable, good size with nice balcony, old tv, a little bit small/old bathroom but in general the room was more than good. Rooms service are fast and friendly. For the concierge they were completely differnet , some was helpfull and aware of the city and our need available with different options but others were in a hurry to end the conversation by whatever reply (correct or wrong info.) to return back to their room. All door men at the hotel are very friendly and efficient, We really appreciated there assistance and there smile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saeed K
Reviews.Content: I was concerned by some of the reviews that the Hotel was aging but I did not find that at all. The Hotel looked clean and I liked the decor. I was able to use the 15th floor lounge and found my room to be excellent. My wife and I were vacationing with two other couples and were treated with excellent service. I found the responsiveness of the staff wonderful and thought that they responded to all of my requests. The location is not ideal for vacationing but we would take a short taxi ride to Kaptos Tramway station and then a quick 10 minute ride to the sites. This is easy and was not an issue. We used the indoor pool and work out facilities as well as the steam room and Sauna. I thought the views from the top floor were beautiful and that the Conrad lived up to its reputation. I also appreciated that I was asked several times how we were doing and if the staff could do more for us. We will definitely come back to Istanbul and we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Delta31tr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Conrad for a short time due to a business trip. Amazing view for the room facing the bosphorus - nice pool and open air breackfast by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and staff makes up for ageing hotel”
Reviews.Author: karin stockholm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in an executive room with a Bosphore bridge view. Just wonderful view as the hotel is located on a hill that gives it an extra good view. I agree with previous writers that this hotel not is as good as Conrad in for e g Singapore but it is still a very good and competitive choice for a stay in Istanbul. The staff is really helpful and serves you in a very nice and polite way. The beverages in the executive lounge ranges from softdrinks to local wine and two sorts of spirits. A small selection of cakes is the high tea and a selection of warm and cold finger food is the evening choice. The view is of course stunning from the executive floor as well as from the bar on the 14th floor. Nice with two breakfasts options for executive floor: continental on floor 15th and a wider selection but still in quiet and peaceful enviroment on floor 14th. Tried the Monet restaurant on the first floor as well in-room dining. Both flawless. Not to mention the cleaning that was so carefully conducted too! Overall a very nice stay. One little thought though: The concierge warned us for local taxis outside the Grand Bazaar. However although it was the same traffic flow in both directions the way home was 12tl cheaper than to the market with the hotels own taxi company......

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Conrad level”
Reviews.Author: Lobster1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Istanbul for three nights on the way home from Dubai. While the hotel was nice, I felt it did not live up to the Conrad brand. The rooms were showing their age and the level of service was OK. I've stayed in Conrad's in Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Delhi, and this one certainly needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Old but still very functional.”
Reviews.Author: popskunk
Reviews.Content: The hotel has seen better ages, but service is good, rooms are clean, and most have really good views of the Bosphorous. Seasons bar at level 14 has an absolutely fantastic view of Istanbul. On the downside, Hotel needs renovation in its rooms and public areas, they really look old, but again, service, views and location are solid good. A good choice for business, not so good for vacations.

Reviews.Title: “fake grand but quite good”
Reviews.Author: simcfro
Reviews.Content: A strangely built hotel - it pretends to be some 19th century classic but it really a handful of years old. Having said that the service is spot on, many breakfast options are available and the rooms are super comfortable. For tourists I wouldn't recommend, it isn't in the greatest area for sightseeing, but it does the job for business travellers based nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Naser D
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right on center for all destinations. Not a rich breakfast but would you get you up till noon till you get hungry again. Warm staff and smiley faces although their English is a problem for most of them and does not get further than good morning. I had minor issues with room service not worth to mention. Would be my choice again in the future. Just make sure to get rooms from floor 11 and up and reserve odd number rooms as they have best views. Best of all do not misplace any hotel towel in your suitcase by any chance as they will open it and take out and hide it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit aloof ......”
Reviews.Author: tonynichollDiss
Reviews.Content: A nice Hotel, but have a half of beer in the music lounge and it will set you back Â£6 .. Just go with plenty of cash and be prepared for surly reception staff, even if you are Diamond Member ..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a bÄ±t tired”
Reviews.Author: 150Londonjp
Reviews.Content: Great spot for visiting the sites but hotel seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hossam_Elgeneidy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Conrad for 1 week in Jan. 2012 on business and it was a very enjoyable stay, the staff are very friendly and the rooms are nice in terms of space and facilities, the breakfast served is very nice with a lot of varities (continental, arabic, tukish, etc...), maybe it's only con is being far from the center spots in istanbul and being far somehow from the nearest subway/tram station nevertheless i would highly recommend to use the taxis infront of conrad and not just any taxi as they are the safest ones in istanbul and it will help you avoid a lot of Taxi scams that could happen to you. If I would go there again on business, i would surely choose Conrad for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shafisara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for 6 nights. I was a bit skeptical after having read some of the negative reviews. Our overall experience was positive. Right from check in to check out we were treated well. We were upgraded to the executive floor with access to the lounge for my HH gold status. 14 and 15 th floor rooms are refurbished and very spacious. Lounge had beautiful views over the Bhosphorus. Staff were attentive, at breakfast they even remembered each day the tea we like. I would second the view that its away from major attractions apart from the Dolbamache palace which is within walking distance. Its a good 20 - 25 min walk to the nearest tram station and then only 15 min by tram to the old town. It snowed a few times when we were there and decided to take a taxi to the tram station and cost around 8TL. We had a meal at the Meze restaurant, i wouldnt say it was exceptional but worth a try. I would be happy to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money up to 120 euro per day”
Reviews.Author: YANNISMIZ
Reviews.Content: Nice location with great Bosporus view but hotel needs renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views - relatively good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a few days. It was very clean and had one of the nicer lobbies / common area spaces I've seen from any other Conrad. Our room was on the executive floor with access to the lounge. The room was a standard hotel room - clean, good view, and well lighted. The lounge was nice, but small and always seemed crowded. There is a lovely terrace attached to the lounge, but as it was quite chilly and it was nicer to stay indoors. I bet during spring and fall it is just the perfect size for a lounge. Breakfast was decent, and the evening snacks were fine. Something much appreciated was the fact that drink service stayed open until 11pm, which was nice. Regarding location, it is about a 20 minute walk from the local tram line that links up with other modes of public transportation. We did the walk once after a long day of self-guided walking tours, and it was completely fine. The last little bit is uphill - but it makes for a good workout before heading to dinner! All in all, I would will stay in this hotel again if I am back for business, but I might stay a bit closer to the sights if I go for personal travel. One way or the other, it is a nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Turkey hotels”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPtravels
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much, good rooms, great restaurants, amazing breakfast buffet, two gyms, indoor and outdoor pool, great service Overall very good experience. I didn't give it five star only because it is a bit far from some attractions, but it is close to the Ferry!!

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: mikel58
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic hotel with a great location and apart from a very slow check in - excellent service the views are fantastic and the port and local life are just a short stroll down the hill to alleys full of great restaurants at very affordable prices

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: walkerholly
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience. The hotel facilities and staff were all top notch. Everything was friendly and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel experience. Rooms so-so”
Reviews.Author: KVP2315
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a holiday weekend. We were impressed by the level of service throughout the hotel. The common areas are updated and typical hotel design. Our room had a beautiful view of the Bosporus and was spacious. It was in serious need of updating however. The carpet was well worn and stained, and the metal bathroom door was yellowed from years of use and perhaps smoking guests in a non-smoking room. The tub and shower need updating badly. Every morning we had to use all of our bathroom towels to wipe up the water caused by the tub's glass half door not keeping the water contained at all. Given that, it was very clean. The Executive lounge was great with amazing views however there were many misbehaved children there practically all the time which made it hard to relax and have a good conversation. Monet, the restaurant, had a great breakfast buffet but the chairs were extremely worn and stained however the restaurant was spotless. We did not get any hard sell for upgrades or services, unlike the other reviewers. It was a great neighborhood with easy public transportation access into town. We liked the location a lot and found everywhere that we went very safe and friendly. The limo transfer service was extremely pricey so we went with an independent carrier for half the price. I would stay there again but would ask for an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Good property...front desk hard sells & misrepresents”
Reviews.Author: apbanerjee
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip. Was booked on a room rate, FD suggested that I change as it would provide free breakfast & also access to lounge & business desk. Total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: m a
Reviews.Content: every thing is exelent but you have to pay 23 TL(15 USD) for 1 hour internet in your room

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, too costly for the facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: ssraja
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Conrad for a day in December while on a work trip to Istanbul. The hotel is okay in terms of its facilities and I don't have any major complaints. However, it is too expensive for the level of service I received and for the facilities in the hotel. I stayed on the 7th floor in a city-facing room, which was fine because I was not expecting to overlook the Bosphorus or anything like that. However, the room has obviously not been updated for a long time. It was certainly clean and comfortable, but not at the level of other hotels I have stayed in around the world--at least at that price level. What was more odd was the service level. For instance, I checked my bags with the concierge and when I came to pick them up, I was asked to "go pick them up yourself". Not a problem, of course, except that my bags were in the storage room and the gentleman who had to get them out was in a bad mood for some reason and was extremely curt in his interactions. Another example: the breakfast area was completely full at about 9am. I can understand that maybe there was a rush of some sort, but I have never faced such a situation before in any breakfast buffet. The choice was also sort of limited, although food was of good quality (as was the room service). I guess the hotel might want to complete what seems to be ongoing renovations (from other reviews). A final factor to consider: as many reviews have pointed out, the hotel is a fair distance from key sight-seeing locations. However, they will help you get a taxi and it costs about 20 TL to get to the Hagia Sophia area and about 25 minutes with fair traffic.

Reviews.Title: “best views over the Edge of Europe”
Reviews.Author: ctraff
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Get an Executive Floor room over looking the Bospherous and you can avail yourself of the Executive Club Floors at the top of the hotel. Even though it is a 20min taxi ride to the Old City, the Hotel is near the port and also a large shopping district between 2 universities.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - strange security”
Reviews.Author: Chris444w
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. I have stayed here twice. Room was fine but they should give you more drinking water. Like many hotels the iron was broken (leaked water). I was a bit perplexed by the security â€“ they always had an x-ray / metal detector but use was inconsistent. They should use this all the time or get rid of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference support, but some rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: gtd123
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights for a conference that took place in the hotel in November. (As others have noted, it is not near any "tourist" destinations but that did not matter to me.) The meeting rooms were spacious and well-equipped. The hotel provided full-time tech support for connecting computers to the projector, miking the speakers, etc. Water was replaced at least once per day for the attendees. The coffee breaks were awesome - coffee, tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, pastries. I had one dinner in the hotel, in the Meze restaurant, and it was fine. Served quickly and politely, and the food was fine. The executive lounge on the 15th floor was also fine, but could get crowded in the early evening. The view of the Bosphorus at night was breathtaking. And the club-floor check in was painless. One important thing to know is that breakfast is served on the 14th floor in what is usually a bar, but the views from there are also lovely, and it is not nearly as crowded as the big breakfast room on the ground floor, or the club lounge either. As other reviewers have noted, however, the bedrooms at least on the 8th floor, were "tired looking." Mine room also had the peeling wallpaper, the chipped paint, the stained carpet, and the mildewed tile grout. It was also annoying that the shower was the American-style fixed on the wall and not removable. At least it was a non-smoking room. There were nice amenities and fantastic towels, thick and large. The fitness area was large and had many machines (could have used better ventilation perhaps). I also appreciated the iron and ironing board and the good light in the bathroom. All in all, it was a nice hotel, the staff were uniformly pleasant, but if I stayed there again, I would ask for a recently-renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Bear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Istanbul for one night prior to a Celebrity cruise leaving from Istanbul. The hotel is large and imposing and as others have pointed out, a bit removed from the tourist stomping grounds. The public areas are lovely. The lobby is dramatic and the breakfast buffet in the beautiful restaurant was bountiful. Having said that, our seventh floor room was just OK. It was adequate enough but I would have expected something a little more plush from a Conrad. Despite the attractive furnishings, the decor was devoid of any personality. The room was not dirty; just tired-looking. Wallpaper was starting to peel and there were some stains and burns in the carpet. Yes, the bathroom was marble, but there was mildew in the bathtub. I'm assuming we were simply assigned a room that hadn't been freshened up yet.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: dontrini
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two separate stays at the Conrad Istanbul last month. The hotel is attractive, nicely appointed and maintained and comfortable. Most especially we heartily applaud the staff and management for the excellent service we consistently received from every department. Every encounter was helpful, professional and friendly yet respectful. From the reception help at our first check-in when a special room request was efficiently and pleasantly accommodated to the bellmen, young gentleman making omelettes, the bartenders, housekeeping staff, business center personnel, waiters both in the main DR and 14th floor sky lounge and concierge manager and staff we could not have been more pleased and impressed. (Of special note is Nihat at the concierge desk whose professional, well informed and friendly assistance made our visit to Istanbul a tourist's delight.) During our stays numerous large conferences and tours moved in and out of the hotel, surely creating an occasional challenge. The staff maintained their helpful, positive attitude and fine service without fail. We applaud the management and staff for the good training, high standards and professional execution of duties that we observed and thank them for the fine service we received and enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a little north of sites”
Reviews.Author: mvburke
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beautiful public spaces, and the meals were delicious. You can walk across the park to many small restaurants favored by young people and university students. The rooms are modern with bathtubs. Istanbul is a huge city and traffic is awful so it is best to stay in a hotel near where you plan to visit. I wanted to go to a Catholic Church (St. Anthony of Padua) and it took me 40 minutes by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Mississauga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days with Insight Tours in Oct. The services in general were very good, people we encountered act professionally. The room is of reasonable size and is clean. To our surprise, no matter where we went in Turkey, the places were clean, even in remote villages. We had problems with the shower, and they fixed it right away. We tried the room service and it was excellent. The food was good, and the price was not as expensive as in the old city area. The breakfast was the best we ever had during the stay in Turkey. (We stayed in Turkey for 20 days) Had a lot of choices, including freshly squeezed orange juice. The service in the restaurant was excellent!! The only drawback of this hotel is its location, it is not close to main attractions nor subway or tram lines.The best way to go around is taking taxis, or walk to the closest station which is 30-45 minutes from the hotel. Taking taxis could be a problem in Istanbul since the traffic jam is unbelievable!!! On the other hand, the taxis in the hotel are safe and reliable since they are with the hotel. If one encountered any problem, just report back to the hotel. It is a big plus for foreign visitors. We have visited cities like Athens before, we had a terrible experience with taxis, and never go back to Greece again. For this reason, taxis in this hotel is a big plus. I don't mind staying in this hotel again in the future. As far as we can tell, it is safe to walk in the hotel vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with turkish delight touch”
Reviews.Author: 130AHMED130
Reviews.Content: the staff are amazing. the food vareity is great,however make sure you are physically fit and able walk uphill

Reviews.Title: “Don`t do it”
Reviews.Author: PeterNandFamily
Reviews.Content: For Work I travel a lot and am lucky to stay in some great hotels. I never write reviews on those but for this I am compelled to write. I have been in many greta Conrads but this is not one. 1960s decor and older carpets make this look more like an old military base than a hotel. The check in service was awful - the guy at the desk looked like I was disturbing his deep slumber by wanting to check in ....even though it was at the Hilton honors desk...no honor at all. The room was okay - just old. Beds were average....But the loud music until 1.30 AM from somewhere did not help for sleeping. The breakfast selection was okay - if a little tired. But 3 requests for Coffee were duly noted and ignored until I lost my patience with the floor manager...who looked more angry at me for complaining than at himself and his incompetent staff for not doing their jobs. All in all the hotel has a feel of a store waiting to be closed down. The staff are not motivated, impolite and unprofessional. Extremely disappointing and for nearly 300 Euros a night it is tantamount to daylight reobbery. If Conrad read this review I hope they conduct a decent research until their own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alina A
Reviews.Content: This is a real top-class hotel. I loved everything. One of the first things I paid attention to is security measures. They thoroughly check every car that drives into the hotel territory, and then there is a metal detector at the entrance as well. Check-in was very fast, and from the moment you leave the taxi you donâ€™t have to care about your luggage, itâ€™s all done for you by friendly and professional staff. By the way, talking about the hotel staff. I would really like to say thank you to Nihat Kilic, the concierge. There was no better person to solve all our problems and answer all our questions than Nihat. He is very intelligent, with excellent manners, sharp dressed man. Everything we asked for was done within a second! What I liked was for example if we asked whatâ€™s the best place to have dinner in, he not only listed the restaurants, he immediately showed them on the map, gave precise directions on how to get there and called the restaurant to reserve a table. What I want to say is that he kind of anticipates guestsâ€™ wishes, he thinks three steps ahead! I remembered his name because he really-really impressed me and I wanted to thank him. During breakfast all the waiters are very attentive, you never have to wait while they suggest coffee or tea, they appear as soon as you sit down. Oh, and the breakfast is splendid! The choice is fantastic, everything is fresh and tasty. When you come to breakfast, you choose the table and while you are choosing your meal, the table is set up. The room. Our room was on the 6th floor. It was big, light and tidy. Tea, coffee were always refilled, cups washed, new vanity kits, soaps, shampoos were given on a daily basis. I did not hear any noise from the street when windows were closed, sound proofing is really good! What I loved was music in the elevator, it always made me smile. I also tried the swimming pool. The same moment you come to the pool, the lifeguard appears and gives you a big-big towel to use for the sun louger. The only disadvantage is that the hotel is not very close to main tourist attractions, but I loved that I could walk to the embankment and have dinner in any of the restaurants with a great view and then come back to the hotel and enjoy a cocktail in the summit bar, which has a fantastic view and warm green blankets to keep you warm at night. I also tried the internet cafÃ© on the 15th floor. You can sit there and there is a choice of snacks there as well, so you can take anything and eat while checking your email or searching the web. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who travels to Istanbul. You can be sure about getting the best service, great rooms and fantastic memories about your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: safaricakes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Conrad 8 times over the past five years and I loved the hotel. The location is great, the restaurants are superb, the rooms are nice and the staff are helpful. I've used the hotel for several occasions: business, couples, family - and would say it fits perfectly every of the above purposes. Things I would say I did not quite like are the spa which is always cold (!!!) and not working properly, the fact that people at reception can never help you with your HHonours card and a fridge that was broken on one occasion. I would rank the hotel as a firm "four" ("very good") but my other half insists it's a "five" ("excellent"), so I'll give it this ranking. The area around is amazing: shops, markets, restaurants - everything one needs for a good stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zsar01
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights at the Conrad in Istanbul and everything was almost perfect. The place was nice and clean and the staff very attentive. The room was very comfortable when compared to their rooms in Europe. It was not the one I booked but I have no complaints besides having two single beds instead of one bed so my partner and I slept separate. The only thing I would like to see them improved is the access to Internet. It really should be free like other Conrads. The wait staff at the roof top bar was very nice and friendly. My drinks were always repleanished on time. Specifically the guy from NYC. Sorry can't remember his name. Hotel was closed by the water. I thought it was a good location. Next time I am in Istanbul ths will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location not condusive for walking”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Spend three nights here as part of a group. Check in was handled efficiently by the executive level staff. Did not receive a Bosphorus view room or even one on the executive level (we're diamond)-was told the hotel was full. Was given access to executive lounge. Rooms were quite and well-appointed. Bathroom amenities are large and fragrant. Beds comfortable. Coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Executive lounge was spacious and one floor below the "rooftop bar" and provided afternoon munchies/tea/coffee/water, evening canapes and beer/wine, and a very adequate breakfast. Staff were gracious and attentive. Not exactly the easiest to access when on foot (taking the metro from Sultanahment). Taxi drivers will try to rip you off when you tell them where you're going, so make sure the meter is on or you negotiate well. They may try to rip you off and refuse to take you to the lobby where the bell man can help out. This didn't happen to us, but be warned as it has happened to others. There are a number of restaurants down Barbarossa if you don't want to eat in the hotel. They're a short (safe) walk away, but you might want a flashlight as it's rather dark in the neighborhood. Take the shortcut through the mosque just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Istanbul is very clean and well maintained. The rooms are quiet and the beds are wonderful. Service is top notch. It is located in a nice part of the city although it is some distance from major attractions. We especially liked the views from the 14th floor lounge overlooking the Bosporous. The lobby and public areas can be quite busy (and noisy) due to meetings and corporate events. The food is good but overpriced. Drinks are also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great when everything works...”
Reviews.Author: Quelian
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a physically impressive hotel. Many of the rooms have fabulous views over the Bosphorus; there is a large outdoor pool; excellent restaurants; free internet at the business centre in 30 minute bursts; a 14th floor bar with breathtaking views... The rooms we had were comfortable, well furnished, had excellent bathrooms and were very well sound insulated. On the down side, the hotel is inconveniently located some distance away from Sultanahmet, Ortakoy and Taksim (and traffic is dreadful, so even short journeys take a long time); wifi is charged at an eye watering 50 lira a day; and bar prices are exorbitant. But perhaps that comes with the territory in a luxury brand hotel. But when things don't work so well, it's a different story. Our luggage had been lost by Turkish Airlines on arrival and they promised to have it delvered by 10 am the next day. We asked over and over again throughout the day. The concierge did call Turkish Airlines and got no helpful response, and the bag hadn't turned up in the hotel's luggage room. Eventually, by late afternoon, we had had to buy replacement clothes, etc and were starting to get frantic as we were leaving to go on tour the next day. The concierge just told us that it takes time to deliver things in Islanbul because of the traffic. Eventually, after an hour of standing at the concierge desk, the concierge left his desk (somewhat begrudgingly) to look for our bags. A few minutes later he returned from the basement with our cases. Goodness knows how long they had been there - perhaps all day. If so, it would have saved us from wasting a precious day of sightseeing and saved us from a lot of anguish. After our tour, we and a couple of other guests had been allocated rooms with twin beds despite our request for double bed rooms. We were upgraded to a suite room with a balcony, which was nice. The other couple were less fortunate and got a room with only an internal window looking over the lobby. And potential visitors will also want to be aware that the hotel hosts many tour groups and conventions. That means lots of people milling around; a noisy lobby and pressure on the lifts. In our return after our tour the hotel was hosting 500 guests wearing identical purple t-shirts. Most of these guests seemed to pass their time riding in the lifts between random floors, making it impossible for other guests to fit in the lifts. On one occasion, it took us ten minutes to get from the 1st floor to the reception - and that was only by getting in an up lift, riding to the top and then all the way back down.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a view!”
Reviews.Author: rcarril
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to have had the opportunity to stay at the Conrad Istanbul for 2 nights during my 2 week visit to Turkey while celebrating my 50th birthday. This hotel although a bit pricey is a very special property with great service and luxury accommodations. It was truly a treat! We had a corner room on the 14th floor with views of Besiktas, the Bosphorus and the old town, Sultanahmed. A delicious breakfast was served every day on the open terrace on the 23rd floor. The pool area is fantastic for relaxing and soaking up some color. The service throughout the entire hotel is flawless and always dished out in the typical warm Turkish manner. I look forward to my next stay when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: eztrav
Reviews.Content: It's a bit expensive and there are a few downsides to staying here but nothing that is the fault of the property. Over all i felt the service was great! I had many interactions with the concierge and I got what i needed with a smile! Can't ask for much else. The room was fabulous and comfortable. I looked forward to returning at the end of the day. The location? not great. On top of a hill with not much near by and since you are staying at the "CONRAD" every taxi driver wants to cheat you! Got taken for a ride 3 times during a 3 night stay. That sucked. But that's not the fault of the hotel by any means. As much as i really loved staying here I would not stay again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C4more
Reviews.Content: Not near the tourist attractions, but a short walk from the Bosphorus and the ferries that cross to the Asian side. Taxis are plentiful or you can try a dolmulsh mini bus. Good views over the Bosphorus. Large rooms, and good conference facilities. Staff attentive as they should be for a high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless and impressive”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkey07
Reviews.Content: From the bell boys to the check-in staff to the staff in the executlve lounge, all stella performance. Simply one of those places where everything, staff and property, ozes quality. Location perhaps not ideal if you're there primarily as a tourist, it's perhaps 10-12 min in a taxi from the bazaar. But it has a very nice view of the Bosporus. I'd definitely stay there again, both for business and pleasure. It is also a short walk from one of the bustling areas in Besiktas, roughly 150 yrds down the hill to the West off of Barbaros Blv. Very nice and more "local" than the tourist traps downtown. BA had lost my bags upon arrival in Istanbul, so my stay had a trying start, but when I came to the hotel their attitude and helpfulness instantly smoothed over that frustration and I just loved Istanbul from then on. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: zorro26
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great service and superb views to the Bosphorus. Rooms are large and clean. Wifi is working well. Excellent for business travelers and not only. Not very close to tourist areas but taxis are easy to find (except rush hours) and low priced. Will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: ectraveller12
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at the Conrad while on business in Istanbul. The hotel was excellent -- great service with large, comfortable rooms. The 15th floor lounge had beautiful views of the Bosphorus. The only drawback is that the hotel is not near the tourist areas but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice huge clean room but a little shop worn”
Reviews.Author: BeachdaddyTucson
Reviews.Content: All amenities good, room was huge, good bed, clean and even on "back side" had great territorial views through wall of windows. Enjoyed space to move around w/o falling over each other. Wi-fi worked, and pools were available, but a storm blew through and didn't take advantage of it. Dining room was less than expected for a Conrad ... service slow to evaporated some times. Quality and value good but nothing all that exciting. I was surprised. Staff were helpful and quick to respond, both with individual questions and getting our group loaded and off to the cruise line.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbourne7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view from hotel room. Comfortable room and spacious. Excellent food and good hairdresser in hotel. Pool is well maintained and very helpful staff. Gift shop and business centre is very convenient in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch”
Reviews.Author: MrTBeirut
Reviews.Content: Deserves the ranking of 5 stars hotel, roof top bar has outstanding view,cordial helpfull staff and good concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful, luxury”
Reviews.Author: USATravelDC
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see anything less than a 5-star rating. This hotel is top-notch. The staff were cordial, knowledgeable and spoke perfect English (helpful to this American). The view from my room was spectacular. The restaurant on site has a great breakfast to get your day started. The World Bank held a meeting in Istanbul the same dates I was there, yet the hotel handled the extra security seamlessly. I was never delayed once, despite a fairly thorough screening system. I would strong recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: kk-trebla
Reviews.Content: I spent the there extended weekend from przyjaciÃ³lmi; we spent. Hotel check in was at the executive reception desc, staffs were very friendly. We paid extra for executive level but is totally worth the extra cost. I was lucky enough to have a corner room with huge windows on 2 sides and views over the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooftop view of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bbb05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at least 50 times in Conrad Istanbul and stayed in a lot of other places in Istanbul. Breakfast in the rooftop lounge (reserved for the executive rooms) has for me the best view in town. Everything in the hotel is at the Hilton group quality level. I loved most the successfull fusion of Hilton quality and Turkish hospitality, ambiance ..... I am retired now , so the hotel is above my budget, as I travel all the time.But I will go back there

Reviews.Title: “A good safe bet”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Safe, opulent, well appointed and not too badly priced. Prices in the rooftop bar are scary compared to what you pay on the street, but apart from that a good hotel and a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: avecarvalho
Reviews.Content: Above average hotel. Good location at Besiktas neighborhood. Nice, clean and spacious rooms. Well equiped fitness room. Fantastic breakfast. Incredible views of the Bosphorus at the terrace restaurant/bar. The only downside is that rooms are not quite sound proof and a nearby mosque has a minarette near some selected rooms, making it difficult to sleep around five o`clock in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, good Bosphorous views but area around can be very congested with traffic”
Reviews.Author: beiruteater
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Hotel when I visited Istanbul for business, the room was decent size, comfortable and had a good view of the Bosphorous. Staff were courteous and service was timely. It is a good business hotel but wouldn't stay here for a holiday, I would opt for a port side hotel. I ordered room service, which was exceptional. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - decent room, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: edconroy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. The hotel has a very good location, very close to the shores of the Bosphorus, 5 minutes from Yildiz Park. The room was very competitively priced relative to other hotels that one might consider for a business trip. My room was fine, although the view of the courtyard was less than inspiring. Explains the cheap (for Istanbul) room rate. The facilities are great for a business traveller - great gym etc, quick, efficient and very friendly service. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in late July for business. While the hotel was taken over by a conference the whole time I was there, the property is big enough that it wasn't a problem. Pros - the facilities are great - nice gym and three great clay tennis courts, although the pool was a tad on the small side. The view from the Summit Bar is fantastic and well worth a visit. I also found the room service to be above the quality of other 5 star properties I've stayed at before. All staff I encountered were professional and friendly as well - much better on the whole than the service I received at the Grand Hyatt on a past visit. Cons - rooms are dated. Because the hotel was at capacity, I was given a room with double beds rather than the king bed I had confirmed before arriving. The location is not bad for reaching areas like Ortakoy and Bebek by taxi, but overall its more isolated than other 5 star properties in the city. Its a 20 minute walk down to the Kabatas stop on the tram that takes you to the city but the walk uphill back to the property may be problematic for some. Overall though a very good hotel that I will definitely consider staying at again if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for two nights before the start of a cruise, having originally been told we'd be at the Grand Hyatt. It was therefore a shame that the Conrad was, frankly, disappointing. Our room faced away from the Bosphorus and had extremely bright floodlights shining on the windows. An attempt had been made to seal the curtains to the walls but this had failed and parts of the curtains were hanging down. The appalling bath/shower tap was of a design we'd only seen before in the USA and the light bulb in the shaving mirror was in pieces. The hotel is way out of town and not on a metro line but the staff didn't know anything about the nearby buses. My wife was disappointed in the limited range of fresh fruit and fresh egg based dishes at breakfast. There's also my usual complaint against many 5* hotels - the ridiculous cost of internet access. I consider that the minimum provision should be free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “osais hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidatlee
Reviews.Content: the hotel is fine - good service, rooms - meze restaurant especially good, bit expensive as would be expected from a hotel. one issue would be taht it not easy to find a dcent place to eat loacally. There are a few bar/food at the bottom of the hill but we could not find anything else. leaves taxi to the town as alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Made our time in Istanbul most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Viruten
Reviews.Content: I registered for this hotel because it was the location of my conference. It seemed expensive for a Turkish hotel, but I decided to treat myself on this trip. Am I glad! Our room was great with an amazing view of the Bosphorus. We also had access to the Club Lounge on the 15th floor and this is what made our stay so great - more amazing views, free Internet access, drinks and snacks all day long. Though the location was remote for visiting tourist attractions, making travel either expensive (taxi) or a long, hot series of walking and public transportation, returning to the hotel always made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: alphabravo1
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in the Conrad. The rooms are lovely, the beds the most comfortable possible. Facilities for business look good but we stayed as a family and used the hotel as a base to explore Istanbul. We had four rooms. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the assistant front office manager, Bora Ozturk was particuarly helpful to us and made our stay very pleasant. Food was first class and not too expensive. Some 5 star hotels are frighteningly expensive to eat in even if you get a good price on a room. Only small downside is that it is a little far to walk to some sights. you need a taxi to get to Taxim Square or Sultanhamnet. But taxis are cheap in Istanbul. On the plus side the views from the hotel are superb over the city and over the Bosporus. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag, check booking beforehand!”
Reviews.Author: jeanette1616
Reviews.Content: Good points, facilities are excellent and Roof top bar has spectacular views, however half the rooms face backwards overlooking each other and a concrete flat roof. Reception staff unhelpful, more interested in business conference delegates. Tourists are used as room fillers i.e. they closed outside pool at 18:00 for business function, just when dusty tourists return to hotel. My sixteen year old daughter was put in a room 4 floors apart from her parents, nothing could be done as the hotel was full with a conference. Many others on same cruise were also split apart from family or friends. It was also very surprising how few staff understood any english and how dis-organised they were i.e. menu in rooftop bar said tortilla chips with salsa dip but turned up with tomatoe sauce. This took 15 minutes for them to resolve. All in all, 5 star facilities but poor customer service and organisation reduce its rating.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: kejey
Reviews.Content: Whilst an older hotel it is pleasant apart from the swimming pool staff. We were traveling with friends and got to the pool 10 mins apart to be told that we couldn't sit together despite there being 8 sun loungers empty next to each other. On questioning the staff and apparent manager ( well the one who could speak English!) we were told the chairs were reserved for a VIP guest who could arrive anytime between 4pm and 8pm. For the 1 hour and 30 mins that we were there they were not used whilst our group of 4 friends all sat separately. Personally I thought Conrad would see all guests as VIP particularly if they expect repeat business. Seems to me the staff are receiving bribes! No free wifi is very annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: azrunbunny
Reviews.Content: The room appeared to be recently renovated, and bathroom was very nice. Views from room and roof were amazing. Staff was friendly, courteous and prompt. The mattress was the most comfortable hotel mattress we've ever had. Very convenient to Bosphorous ferries, but traffic is difficult to Old Town. Can take over an hour to get to or from Blue Mosque area.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Business Hotel in Istanbul with Good Security”
Reviews.Author: Abc123XYZ3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Istanbul in June 2011 while traveling on business. Other travelers have commented on Trip Advisor that the property is dated. While it is true that the individual rooms could use some sprucing up, the overall property is quite nice, including the lobby, restaurants, executive lounge and the outdoor pool. The room accommodations on the executive floor are comfortable and tastefully decorated, but the bathrooms are very small. The Meze restaurant in the hotel has a good variety of tapas-style dishes. For something different, try the buffalo yogurt, which is made from buffalo milk and served chilled. The Summit Bar on the 14th floor has a spectacular view of the water and surrounding city. It also serves complimentary breakfast for executive floor guests. The breakfast includes a hot and cold buffet with a good selection. For a bigger selection, you can pay for a buffet in the lobby restaurant, Monet. The hotel also has an executive lounge on the 15th floor with complimentary internet access and complimentary hot and cold snacks and drinks during the day. The staff on the executive floor are very friendly and helpful. Security in the hotel lobby is good, and you and your belongings will be screened each time you enter the hotel. Taxi cabs also are screened prior to entering the hotel property. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to Dolmabahce Palace, but most of the other top historical attractions in Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are about a 20 minute cab ride away, depending on the traffic, which can be very heavy in the morning and in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Away from old town - average service”
Reviews.Author: APMD
Reviews.Content: Hotel is away from most turistic areas. Cab to old town is anywhere between 10-20TL. Rooms are clean. Internet is not included in room price and expensive. (u're better off getting free wifi at the cafes in the old town - lunch for two will likely be cheaper than 1 day of wifi at conrad). Services at the hotel are not the greatest - concierge (pm especially) is useless. Room preference is meaningless - Asked for high floor close to elevator got low floor about as far from elevator as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: LTT01
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, but small bathroom, impossible for two people to use it at the same time. Very good Spa and briljant fitness. Situated in a quiet area

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: jonny_spew
Reviews.Content: As part of a group of friends and family we stayed here for 4 nights for the Turkish Grand Prix. The hotel was lovely, with good service and a good selection of food in their restaurants. Having stayed at a few Hiltons/Conrads here was probably the best for breakfast with a huge choice. Although not close to the main tourist sites the hotel was reasonably well located in Besiktas, just a short taxi/tram ride to Taksim. Walking along the river taking in the sites to the blue mosque took around about an hour. As you come out of the hotel there are some nice bars and restaurants at the very bottom of the hill by the riverside. The bar on the top floor has amazing views over the city and is definitely worth checking out for a cocktail! The only downside of our time there was the fact the swimming pool was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection!”
Reviews.Author: tfiorentino
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location a bit isolated and which the taxi drivers use their advantage to drop you off before getting to the hotel to rip you off, without you being aided by the hotel staff (it happened on every ride!), the hotel is absolutely fantastic in everything: food (breakfast, lunch, diner), rooms, facilities, staff, and beautiful rooftop terrace with bar overlooking Bosphorous... truly enchanting! Again, watch out for taxi drivers making up all excuses not to drop you off at the hotel front!

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a classical luxury hotel in Istanbul. Great hotel, with good restaurants, comfortable and modern rooms and a great staff. Nicely located at walking distance from the Bosphorus Strait. The high point is defiantly the bar at the 14th floor, a fantastic view of the city and the straight! Donâ€™t miss it!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigteacher
Reviews.Content: This is a very alrge and pretty well located business hotel in Istanbul. We really liked "The Summit" on the 14th floor for beautiful views, excellent drinks and good food (great lamb chops). Positives: Excellent service- staff very helpful and accommodating. Very good security. Good breakfast buffet. Excellent gym-separate weight room and cardio room- very nice and new cardio equipment. Indoor and outdoor pool and clay tennis court-if that's your thing. Nice park with basketball court and children's playground across the street. Very comfortable beds. Great views of the city. Not far from tram into Old Istanbul and near Taksim area. Close to ferry terminal at Kabats. Four Seasons is down the street-go there for a drink. Negatives- The rooms are looking a bit tired. Beds very comfortable, as I said before, but rooms stuck in the early 90's. Internet access, like most hotels, highway robbery. You also get charged for many things-at least the gym was free. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to friends and colleagues. Most of all, they had excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Safe, Comfortable and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Security is an issue in Istanbul..You see it everywhere, and the Conrad is no exception with obvious but un invasive measures. Rooms were great..Get them on the Bosphorous side if you can, though over the Park can be nice too. The bars on the roof are very nice..and be prepared to pay mad money for drinks. It is a good location for business, but for tourism its a little distant from the old town and the traffic is simply ?o!#****! in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Average !!! Nothin Special.. Could be Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul218
Reviews.Content: Basically i will repeat what has been said before, i stayed from 24-28 April 2011, the only 5 star part is the lobby & some service, rooms and bathrooms seriously need to be updated, the hotel was packed during my stay, our company was hosting a seminar at the Conrad and our group coordinator Ms. Zeynep AkÄ±n, did an excellent job, Thank you Zeynep for making our event a success. All in all , nothing special about the hotel, location not so good if you want to visit sights, always wear comfy shoes, Ladies NO HEELS!!! would i stay there again?? if my company paid YES...if i had to pay DEFINITLY NOT.. nothing justifies the price..by the way internet is NOT FREE !!! ISTANBUL is amazing ..so much to see...so enjoy it no matter the hotel

Reviews.Title: “would not class it as 5 star.The only thing 5star is the look of lobby.”
Reviews.Author: tourinfofriend
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby golden chanderliers and lift doors but rest of hotel is like a different Hotel. Every other floor was standard black lift doors standard carpeting.The bathrooms and rooms were not 5 class.They were as ordinary as 3 or 4 star.They say complimentary bottle water but its only for the 1st day and only 2 small bottles of water per room for 2 persons or more.We had 2 bottles but we were 3 persons in a room.The internet was ten pounds per hour.You had to pay to use their car park each day if you had a car.the staff could not speak or understand simple english.The breakfast buffet was like 3 or 4 star hotel food nothing special.Lack of seating at any time of going for breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: RobynPringTravel
Reviews.Content: I don't generally like big chain hotels, but I spent 3 nights at the Conrad as part of a tour group this February and March. The beds are very comfortable, city view are pretty good and they have an amazing breakfast spread boasting every food type imaginable. We spent two nights here at the start of the trip and 1 night at the end. I left my cell phone charger behind after the first stay. They located it and held it for me. When our group returned to Istanbul, we were all upgraded to giant suites for the night. We all had kitchens, or balconies, huge closets, and a cushy living space. My whole group was treated very well there. Two things I did not like are the lack of free internet. This is one of my main qualms with chain hotels. Smaller hotels don't nickel and dime so much and usually include internet. The hotel had several "buy in" options, but in this day and age free internet is a must in hospitality. Also, it is located up on a hill, far from a lot of the main tourist attractions. If I were on my own, I probably would have chose to stay closer to the Topkapi area, but for a hotel used on a tour the Conrad gave us a really enjoyable stay. Great customer service and extra comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night to wrap up our Easter weekend in Istanbul. Having enjoyed the Conrad experience elsewhere we hoped this would be a good end to our break but it was far from it and our stay at the Conrad turned out to be much inferior to our time at the Hilton Istanbul where we hadbeen based immediately before moving here. This is strange beacuse I thought Conrad was supposed to be a step up from Hilton bu,t in Istanbul at least, it seems that the profiles of each property are reversed. When we arrived at the Conrad we were checked in by a self-important staff member who really couldn't be bothered. She threw us a piece of paper explaining that the Club Lounge was closed for repairs and provided us with no other information about the hotel at all. We made our way to the room which was on the 15th Floor. It was small and the bathroom, which was really really small, smelled of stagnant water. The furnishings were dated and poorly maintained - the base of the bed was frayed and the whole room just looked tired. With the ClubLounge closed we stopped by the Summit Lounge on the 14th floor which, we were informed by the note we'd been given at check-in, was where the Club Lounge was relocated during the refurbishment works. Here we encountered two very offhand staff - we asked if we were in the right place for the Club Lounge and they just gestured to a table laid out with a few drinks and snacks and then got on with serving the Summit Bar customers who shared the space. We felt very unwelcome and as if we were just an inconvenience to the staff here. This was a shame because the Summit Bar and its Terrace has the best view of Istanbul we encountered during our time in this excellent City. When we checked in to our room at 3pm we had noticed very loud music playing directly outside the hotel. We assumed this would be short-lived and ignored it. After dinner we got back to our room to find a note from management to all guests warning of unrelated road and bridge closures in the City, but no mention of the mucic which was now playing even louder and, given that you couldn't speak easily on the phone as a result, was certain to spell a disturbed night's sleep for us. I called the Help Desk to log this politely and was told very brusquely that someone would get back to me once they had investigated. After 30 minutes I had heard nothing more so called again at which point the agent answered and then immediately disconnected me. I called a third time and before I could speak was told angrily by the agent that the duty manager was still investigating and would call back. A full hour after I'd first reported the problem the duty manager called to explain that he had just discovered that we were being disturbed by a music festival at the neighbouring University and that it should stop by midnight. The fact that this had seemingly taken the hotel by surprise, particularly given that the noise had been playing continuously for the previuos seven hours at least, was disappointing. The Duty Manager then arranged for a key for a different room on the other side of the hotel to be brought to us but by now it was almost midnight and we just gave up and sat out the final round of music noise in our existing room. Next morning came breakfast in the main restaurant - great food and hardworking staff who remained cheerful despite a crazy workload. The restaurant was totally overwhelmed by the numbers of guests and you just felt like you wanted to eat and escape the stress fast. There were several bus groups staying - which perhaps made things worse? If you plan to sight-see the Conrad's location is not great. It is not near the tram or metro so you need to travel by taxi which we found very slow given the heavy city traffic. As we left we approached the Concierge for help with taxi arrangements to the airport and she was as offhand as so many of the other staff we encountered during our stay. We checked out and of course the agent did not check we'd enjoyed our stay - but by now we had no expectations of such customer service basics and really were just relieved to be out. On the basis of our experience this last weekend I sadly conclude that this Conrad has none of the upscale credentials that its brand name suggests and that are shared by other properties in the Group. The in-room coffee machines here are good, the bathroom soaps and shampoos etc appealing, and the views form the Summit Bar breathtaking but those things aside, balanced as I'm often told I am(!), I'm afraid I can't think of a single other good thing to say in favour of the Conrad Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Where to relax in a bustling town”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: We finished our Morroco, Paris, Turkey trip with two nights at the Conrad Hotel to relax and unwind. It was perfect. We had a good view from our high room, but the views from the 15th floor executive lounge and terrace were spectacular. I understand they moved the lounge from the 15th to the 14th floor the day we left so donâ€™t know whatâ€™s become of that great outdoor terrace. During our stay, the 14th floor was used for breakfast. The hotel is somewhat isolated but we walked down to the docks then to Dolmabahce Palace; but the lines on Sunday were forbiddingly long. We took a taxi to the bustling streets around Taksim, then back to the hotel, both short trips. We had excellent meals in the Meze 2nd - floor restaurant and the Monet ground-floor restaurant, particularly the lamb, and thought both meals uncommonly good for hotel restaurants. Prices were comparable to good restaurants in town. Our only fault with the hotel was being unable to reach the concierge over two days by phone prior to our stay to arrange for car service to and from the hotel. The hotel operator answered evening and morning but no one answered after transfer. So we arranged our return from Cappodocia ourselves with a car service weâ€™d used earlier while staying in Sultanahmet. Unfortunately, Turkish Airlines pushed our flight back a couple hours and I didnâ€™t have the car service phone number. On arrival at Ataturk Airport, Ali Ekber Bakir of istanbulairporttransfer was there to greet us and get us to the Conrad, then two days later, on time for our 3:15 a.m. pickup for the early flight home, so transportation worked out. The hotel is in a fine neighborhood for walking and across the street from the hotel is a park with sidewalks, benches, and some childrenâ€™sâ€™ equipment. Across the street beyond the park are a number of small restaurants. Quiet and comfortable, with beautiful views, the Conrad was a good place to stay just outside the bustle of heavy Istanbul activity.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad twice - at the beginning (one night) and on completion (two nights) of an Insight Vacations tour of Turkey. The hotel was pretty ordinary for a 5 star property. The room was small and there was no view. The skirting boards were scuffed and the room smelled of smoke, even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The shower was over the bath, with a nylon shower curtain! The bed was very comfortable, though, with excellent linen. Breakfast on our first morning was in the Conrad's better restaurant, and was excellent, as was the service. However, when we returned to Istanbul towards the end of our tour, our breakfast on each morning was in a different location down near the hotel's Business Centre (perhaps reserved for tour groups), the food was inferior, and the service was poor. The Conrad's location is very handy to the Besiktas Ferry Terminal, from which one can catch ferries to many locations, and to small supermarkets and an internet cafe across from the very busy main road through the small park in front of the hotel. We had room service one night (soup and mezze) and were pleasantly surprised at the excellent quality of the reasonably priced food. A warning though - wine is outrageously priced at the Conrad. You can purchase Turkish wine of reasonable quality at the small supermarkets across the road. Is the Conrad hotel value for money? Absolutely not! We moved to the Sirkeci Konak Hotel for four nights after the completion of our tour. The Sirkeci Konak was truly excellent value for money, with stunning meals and outstandingly helpful staff, in a location that could not be bettered!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_pa
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in (and I was so full of myself when I heard that Obama was there, too). We were on the Executive Floor, the room was spatious, partly overlooking the Bosphorus and partly the other part of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. In terms of cleanliness, everything was spotless. The food in the Monet restaurant is absolutely amazing. Buffet breakfast is served on more than a dozen tables and it offers anything you could possibly want. As for the dinner, I had the best yellow lentil soup and the best dessert ever (warm chocolate fondant with walnut ice cream and almond tuille). So goooood! The only thing I disliked were the toiletries. I think that a 5* hotel should offer something more fancier instead of a no-name green toiletries! My hands were stinging from the green liquid hand soap.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but not a conrad imo”
Reviews.Author: rudolpho79
Reviews.Content: i think the conrad is a good property but if you dont have business in this area you are far away from everything. the rooms are good but not luxury at all. its no coincidence that the rates are often lower than at the hilton. i expected more from the conrad but i would choose the hilton over the conrad now, mainly because i didnt receive any upgrade in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but be prepared to pay for internet access”
Reviews.Author: woobie772
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here at the end of our 10 day tour. The lobby was opulent and inviting, but the woman at the concierge desk was somewhat brusque and dismissive. She didn't bother to offer me an English-language newspaper--something I greatly appreciate at foreign hotels--even though there were several stacked on a table right behind her. Lovely Acca Kappa toiletries in the bathroom and a powerful hair dryer, all greatly appreciated. Robes provided, but turn-down service included only one pair of slippers and one bottle of water on a single side of the double bed. A few English-language TV stations but, oddly for a high-end hotel, no pay-movie channels with still-in-theatres or new release titles. Also surprising: For such an expensive hotel, wireless internet was NOT included, nor was use of a computer free in the hotel's business center. You even had to pay to print your airline boarding pass! When you're paying a lot for a room, it really annoys me to have to pay extra for things that even less expensive hotels tend to include free of charge. To see a bit of the non-touristy Istanbul, turn left when you exit the hotel, walk a few blocks, then turn right and walk down a flight of stairs next to a mosque, cross the street, then enjoy exploring the shops and restaurants where the locals buy and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Restored my faith in the hotel/brand”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed multiple times and had a very poor experience during my prior stay. In fairness to the hotel, they did provide a free weekend stay to compensate for this. I stayed recently with my wife & overall would say they restored my faith in the hotel & brand. Positives: 1) Quick, professional check-in. The guest manager welcomed us and got us to our room very efficiently. 2) Large room, all amenities needed included. Benefited from the executive room package, so had free drinks/snacks refreshed daily. 3) Excellent maid service, twice daily towel refresh, etc. 4) Great breakfast selection. 5) Reasonable location...10-20mins to many of main attractions and good restaurants...but enough away to benefit from a little peace. 6) Good shower...strong with plenty of hot water. Negatives: 1) Only negative (& this is minor) relates to the room doors. They shut automotically and are heavy doors...so you hear them slamming early morning and if your hand slips, the door slams shut. Not ideal for sleeping through early morning activitiy. 2) Beds are soft with good bedding, but a touch "lumpy"...nothing terrible but not perfect in respect of a 5 star hotel. Overall very positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: qsaadia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for three nights during our trip to Istanbul. It is a bit far from the Sultanahmet and Taksim areas, so we had to spend money on taking cabs to the train station. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member so we got access to the executive lounge, which has incredible views of the Bosphorus. Our room was nice, although a little smaller than we expected (but hey, it is Europe!). The hotel is very clean and classy. Breakfast was wonderful, they had fresh squeezed juices every morning, fresh fruit, and made-to-order eggs. The conceirge were polite and helpful, as was the staff overall.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ketanmist
Reviews.Content: if you dont mind the money, then this is THE hotel. very clean rooms, friendly staff, very helpful,too. very good vegetarian food

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service You Expect”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent and this is the type of service you would expect from a top Hilton brand. This is where Obama stayed in Istanbul, so you can imagine the standards that are set. The views from the Summit Terrace are absolutely the best. A funny story also about the bartender. He was speaking with a very distinct accent, but when he said, "Lawn Guy-land" I knew he was the geninue thing! He was raised in Long Island, but moved back to Istanbul and actually had to take 3 years of Turkish lessons to speak his "mother tongue!" The only real downside is that this place is not located on a hillside with zero tourist attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I would have expected - very old bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: tjp1994
Reviews.Content: The Conrad as the upper scale group of Hilton has many awesome hotels. I have practically been in all of them but Conrad Istanbul was not as nice as the others. I booked a seaview room (more expensive then 'city view') and got a room that did see a very small part of the water, but mainly overlooking a derelict old dirty building to the north. I complained and recieved a (far better) room with a nice balcony overlooking the water. I do believe that was because I am a gold hhonors member. The room was large enough and had everything you would would find in all the other 4 star hotels. The bathroom was a huge let down. It was extremely small and I think that a 4 or 5 star hotel and especially Conrad should not have old bathrooms with shower curtains and showers in baths. The taps were old and hanging loose. The biggest irritation however came from the bathrooms of fellow guests: when one of the neighbours was taking a bath or a shower that created a lot of noise. My neighbour took baths late at night and you could literally hear the water flowing in the bath. It kept me awake until late at night. In the early morning several other guests took baths/showers which again woke me up very early. It resulted in bad sleep and irritation.
