It is probably the pipes that are extremely old or something, it wass very frustrating. The lounges on top are nice, but not more special then any regular Asian Hilton hotel. I have been in Conrad Singapore and Hong Kong and these are much nicer. Even the regular Hilton hotels are better in Asia compared to Conrad Istanbul. The views are stunning I must admit. Probably the best view in Istanbul. Don't think the hotel is not nice, it is still a good choice, although very far from tourist attractions. Traffic in Istanbul can be horrendous (it took me two hours from airport to hotel by taxi), and there are not metros in the near vicinity. All in all, I expected more from a hotel that is supposedly voted as one of Forbes' best 500 hotels in the world.....

Reviews.Title: “World-class service with a world famous view”
Reviews.Author: Spadina2
Reviews.Content: Smooth, professional check-in and check-out. Extremely comfortable bed and spacious room. Genial concierge. Prompt room service. My check-out was at 4 am so they offered me a take-away breakfast box, which wasn't that good but it was a nice gesture. As other posters have noted, the bar on the top floor is a superb spot to view the Bosporus as the sun sets.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Elmaz
Reviews.Content: Location is not that bad as I had expected. BK, Pizza Hut and McD's are quite near and you can also try not-so-expensive Turkish eateries across the road. Staff is very courteous. The suite (at 10th floor) had most of the stuff in double (telephone, loo, flat tv). Had a lovely terrace with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “MAGICAL”
Reviews.Author: ChrisParis4
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5 day business trip to Istanbul, a city I come to regularly on business and where I try to always have some free time to enjoy it. I usually stay at a nearby hotel, where I was satisfied, yet never felt really special. This time I decided to try the Conrad which I remembered from... 1992 when I was on a Group Tour and they had provided me gracefully with a nice Bosphorus view room. This time, after checking their special offer, I had decided to go for a suite over the week-end after the first night in a different room categoryb to benefit from their week-end offer! It all started off pretty badly... Instead of a Bosphorus view Room with internet access (booked through their internet site), I was given a city view room with no internet access on a shabby floor (the 7th). Upon complaining, I was immediately given satisfaction from reception supervisor, who transfered me to un upgraded room oh the 10h floor and checked everyting was now ok. The following day, they had organized my transfer to the suite, following reservations department; on the 7th floor again, The suite had the "contractual" view and size but was in bad need for renovation; I quickly went down to reception and asked for another room; I was again immediately given satisfaction and transfered to one of the nicest suites I have been to. Executive lounge is excellent with personalized service (you are recognized immediately once you have been there once). Breakfast downstairs in the restaurant is not only good but service is highly professional and pleasant. One nice detail: you have to run after the staff to tip them as they never seem to expect it (while they deserve it much more than others).Conclusion: reservations department is terrible and needs reshuffling but everyone else (special thanks to Taner) will try their best to satisfy the customers and make your stay a magical one. Am coming back there next week (this time for a personal week-end).

Reviews.Title: “business hotel- outrageous internet fees”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: the hotel is fine- a typical business hotel.- but why does internet use in your room cost about as much as a night in a decent hotel somewhere else in town? It's ironic that 5 star hotels charge through the nose for Internet, wheras cheap and middle-class hotels offer internet for free. Clearly the objective is to milk the business traveler as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: Well - I'm getting around to reporting on more of the Hotels we stayed in. This stay was in August 2009. Approximately a week. We also visited Gallipolli and did the usual City tours and walking trips. We were a tad apprehensive about Istanbul to start with. We had no real idea of what to expect - but imagined something like Athens. This is probably correct. A very cosmopolitan city, where everyone is accepted for who they are. Turks are a proud race - who love their city. They are not Arabs - a mistake many make (and this in no way is meant as an insult to Arabs) . One of the first things we did was buy an acbil each (for travel on every convenience - bus, tram, ferry etc - and VERY cheap). We saw the spice markets, the museums, the religious buildings, the waterways etc - and would love to go back. Istanbul was perhaps the highlight of our trip. Which I still find unbelieveable ! The hotel is a little out of the main area - but very easy to get around. Returning from the spice markets on one day we took the tram (airconditioned and modern) half way (end of the line), then the bus (not as new - but fun) - and were dropped off at our front door. Much to the amusement of others on board (we gathered those in this Hotel didn't normally travel this way). This - in itself is an experience ! It was also easy to walk down the hill to the dock - and take a ferry into the other parts of the town. It is fun to try both methods. And nothing is that far. You can also plan a trip up the Bosphorus or the horn by ferry - very cheap - and use the acbil. The planning is half the fun - and staff at the Hotel can help. The hotel is extremely safe - everyone from Presidents to Prime Ministers have stayed there. It is almost perfect. Good staff, a friendly environment, and plenty to do (eg the pool). I noticed that "Insight" use it for some of their tours. It is very "Anglo/American" in many ways - but a pleasure to stay at. The views from the top floors are awesome. A tip - don't be frightened to sit at an outdoor "cafe" and enjoy the local coffee (perhaps with raki/ouzo) and an apple tea and just watch the passing parade. Also - use the local transport. Cabs are available - but not as much fun. The hotel helped make the trip the success it was. Excellent rooms, food, layout. Although - it is not cheap - so look for "deals" ... :) Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Terrific traffic”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off one of the main roads in Istanbul, but suffers from poor access, and on one occasion it took us 20 minutes to get from the hotel to the road about 100 metres away, so allow plenty of time to get anywhere. Rooms are reasonably sized, but do suffer from the persistent traffic noise. I had to wear earplugs in order to get a good nights sleep (7th floor facing the road). For a top class hotel there were signs of wear, and the place could do with a makeover. Things like dated marble in the bathroom, tired grouting and sealant, saggy bedsprings and the occasional chips and stains detracted from the image that Hilton would like to portray for one of their top brands. Breakfast was reasonable, with good service. We were there the month after the bombing and security was evident both on entry to the grounds (by taxi) and upon entering the hotel. No free wifi (circa â‚¬25/day) and no free internet in the business centre did not endear the hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: caropiano
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful room with a great view of the Bosphorus bridge - specatcular at night. The lobby is beautiful, The breakfast was wonderful, with an attentive and fun wait staff. I would definitely recommend this as a very service-orented and ,gracious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Given the VIP Treatment & a Postcard View”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: Nowadays, it is so rare that those in the hospitality industry aspire to go above and beyond what is expected. I was warmly greeted with such personalized attention the second I stepped outside the car. I was immediately escorted to a private check-in floor while my bags were being taken to my room. When I entered, I had a personalized message from the manager welcoming me to The Conrad, Istanbul, which just reiterated the same warm verbal welcome I received from the bellman and the staff associated who informed me of the great number of resources available to me while I was a guest of the hotel. While I had a postcard view of the Bosphorous from my room, I could further embrace that beauty and enjoy drinks, snacks, reading material and conversation with fellow guests. The Conrad, Istanbul was a breath of fresh air when it comes to the hospitality industry. My requests were handled to my satisfactions, quickly and it was flattering to know that President Obama had also stayed at the hotel in April 2009. The one and only criticism I have of the hotel and its services is the exorbitant in-room internet fees. Hopefully those either have been or will be readjusted to a more industry competitive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view of Bosphorus from the top of the hill with great service”
Reviews.Author: daffofils
Reviews.Content: Nice location up the hill with wonderful view of the Bosphorus. From your room or SUMMIT BAR it is a great place to watch the boat traffice day and night. THe rooms are spacious with all the basics. If the weather is warm you can't beat the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not nice enough to justify the additional cost”
Reviews.Author: dskid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two nights of the organized part of our tour of Turkey. The room had two twin beds; nice towels, face clothes, Kleenex, 36â€� LCD TV, mini bar, desk, two side chairs, table, large closet with safe, two hair dryers, large vanity. There was an adjoining room and it was very easy to hear people in other room. The breakfast buffet was okay but nothing one doesn't find most other places. They will do eggs to order but you have to ask since they do them in the back and it's not obvious. The hotel is on a big hill and not really within easy walking distance of any of the tourist sights and the local shopping that is down the hill near the hotel is nice to see for local flavor but after one has walked around for about an hour there's not much more to see. My personal preference is to be in a hotel that's closer to sites or interesting shopping - both for business and leisure travel. One warning: Count your change at the hotel. I asked for smaller bills and while I watched the desk clerk count out the money before I put it in my wallet, when I got back to the room I took the money out and realized that I was 50 lira short.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the most convenient hotel for first time visitor to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 1funmom
Reviews.Content: Common areas of the hotel are very nice, rooms fairly standard. Staff extremely attentive. Breakfast Buffet is excellent. For us, the location was a disappointment. There are fast food places within walking distance, but no upscale cafes or boutiques for window shopping. You have to take a taxi to get to the metro station to get to the Old City for sightseeing, or to Taksim Square. It seemed we always had to take a taxi, and budget how much time to get there. It is not in an area where you can step outside of the hotel and wander looking at particularly interesting things. Also, for the price we paid I think free internet should have been offered in the lobby, but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joerg
Reviews.Content: I was visiting the Conrad hotel for business trip and I combined it with a private holiday with my wife. We both enjoyed it very much and it is definitely one of nicest designed hotels. it looks great from out side for a large business hotel and from nearly every room you have a fantastic view to the city or the Bosporus. The pricing structure is unfortunately similar to big hotels. In that case its nice to have access to the Executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: lj55c
Reviews.Content: Location was fair. We had a private driver from Airport and it took at least a hour and a half. ( Driver stopped for directions at least 8 time) I will not fault the service that I received from the staff, it was excellent. From check in to departure and everything in between the staff was very helpful. We were upgraded and allowed access to the executive lounge. My room was another story. It was very dated and well worn. There was mold in the bathroom. King bed consisted of two pushed together to make a king., somewhat common. I should have asked for another room so I only have myself to blame. My coworkers had no problems with their rooms. The only place we visited was the Grand Bazaar due to it rain during our stay. About a 30-45 minute ride and 15-30 Lira cab fare depending on the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury escape in busy city”
Reviews.Author: HendleyandBlythe
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, helpful with tips about visiting the tourist sites. Hotel was full so was upgraded to executive room, fabulous views from the top floor lounge. Really special. Great conference location. 20-30 mins by taxis dependant on the terrible traffic to old city.not ideal if you just are visiting s tourist. Pool next to what is currently a building site,so not very tranquil at present.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: MajedAlmasri
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul (a great city), we were lucky to stay at CONRAD, nice hotel, nice location & nice staff. We had 3 rooms at the 11th. floor with Bosphorus view. The location of the hotel is one of the best, you could have a walk around to shop, eat or just to sit by the sea and enjoy the view. Many thanks to Halide at the reception, she is so kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hilton Istanbul - Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Down_Under01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and again in September. Both experiences were brilliant. We emailed the Conrad earlier as our arrangements were a little complicated. When we arrived, everything was organized as requested. What really impressed us about this Hilton hotel (they are all good!) was the staff. They were professional, helpful, happy, friendly and genuinely caring and interested in our activities. And I mean all the staff. What ever the management are doing there, they have got it right. A doorman took particularly good care of us after an unfortunate taxi experience (what is it about taxi driver rip offs?!) and advised he would pay the correct fee to the driver in the future and we could just pay him. (FYI â€“ the Conrad has itâ€™s own â€œcheckedâ€� taxis which are excellent. Hailing one from the street to get there was our problem.) Our room was brilliant. We paid for an Executive Room â€“ Bosphourus View, which gave us access to included drinks, hors dâ€™oeuvres, a breakfast restaurant on our floor, (freshly squeezed juice) roof top lounge style seating, office facilities and internet. Our room was serviced twice a day, was spacious and spotless. And what a view! If there is a downside, itâ€™s a fair way from the city centre, not cheap, and if you arenâ€™t on the executive floors you miss out on the â€œfreeâ€� stuff. However, fellow travelers on other floors told us they were very happy and impressed with their rooms. The excellent staff attitudes here set this hotel apart from many others. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Truly spectacular view from the 14th and 15th floors”
Reviews.Author: Airlineconsultant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the 14th/15th floors, where you get a truly amazing view of the Bosphorus and the stunning city of Istanbul. The sunshine sparkling on the straight, the ferry boats, mammoth cruise ships, mosques, bridges, hills, vibrancy of the city â€“ all incredible and uplifting. Breakfast is served is served on the 14th floor â€“ the food is OKish, but you wonâ€™t notice because the view is so spectacular, whether you choose to eat inside or out on the terrace â€“ what a fantastic way to start your day. Otherwise, the rooms are relatively typical for a 4 to 5 star property; my room had no view to speak of, although others possibly did have Bosphorus views. There was a free bottle of mineral water. The shower head was unusually low (had to bend my knees to get my head under!) One of the other reviewers described the lobby area as â€œsereneâ€� and I can see what they mean .... it is somehow calm and tranquil compared to the chaos and traffic jams of the Istanbul of outside. Iâ€™d come back here ..... but just make sure your room type gives you access to the 14th/15th floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for conferences”
Reviews.Author: jdandjm
Reviews.Content: Prominent, plush hotel, high above the northern side of the Bosphorus. It may be near a business district, but is a long way from the old city centre and far from the end of the trolley line. But taxis are cheap and there are plenty of them. As there are no shops close to the hotel, just walk across the Barbaros boulevard and down toward the water, where you will find many shops and restaurants in the side streets. The hotel has three restaurants. Great views from almost any floor. Check out the 14th level bar/restaurant. Our room was a reasonable size with ensuite to match. Unfortunately it reeked of cigarette smoke when we walked in. Being able to open the windows helped considerably. Only one suitcase stand. Our room information book was mostly in Turkish as some of the English pages were missing. Found access to the internet (cable or WiFi) was the most expensive ever encountered. Down in the business centre it's cheaper if you only need a few minutes on their computers. Super cheap internet cafes over in the shopping area. The cost of telephone calls from your room can be exhorbitant. Suitably large plasma TV with lots of channels in about four languages. Unfortunately the image quality was particularly poor. The ensuite had most things but a power point for the hair dryer. The shower/bath plumbing is rather complicated (no intructions). The glass shower screen is too narrow as the floor gets wet. And there is no safety grab-rail at the shower/bath. The toilet is an old American model and takes up more floor space than need be these days. Apart from these little problems, at least the towels were huge, there was good lighting and a wall to wall benchtop. Breakfast was sumptuous but chaotic as a number of tour groups were competing for tables and food. This is good hotel for conferences and business meetings but not for your average independent tourist.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: gueg2500
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Istanbul is beautifully located on top of a hill overlooking the Bosporus. Wonderful views from the roof terrace. Friendly service, roomy rooms and an excellent breakfast buffet maked my stay a pleasant one. From the hotel location ferry boats and restaurants are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average service”
Reviews.Author: Karwie
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very friendly but not exactly speedy, a somewhat understaffed area of the hotel. The location was very nice, just as the view. However, do not expect to be stunned by the Bosporos at night because the room-windows are double tinted from both sides so all you see when its dark outside is yourself. The room are otherwise well kept and equipped but nothing exceptional at this price range. Concierge service was OK. Breakfast buffet was very nice. The Gym area and the outdoor pool were large enough, do not expect much pool service. The business and meeting facilities were very good, that is a true strong point of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: MKroese
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with great bar and fantastic view!

Reviews.Title: “excellent views from Executive Floor lounge and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: asyamadhu
Reviews.Content: I always find their service faultless. The breakfast room get a bit crowded though. Being a VIP member of the Hilton Honours, the complimentary things showered makes me feel good - like the executive floor, free wifi etc. The hotel rates vary a lot depending upon your timing of the booking, and at the higher band, the room rates do not justify the quality compared to other equally good hotels in the vicinity. The hotel is nicely located and the views of the Bosphorus are stunning, even though from a distance. The indoor pool is very shallow at one end and desn't enthuse much if one is serious about swimming. I would recommend this hotel at the lower band of the rates 120-150 Euro. Manish Joshi

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, top quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyGreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for our honeymoon and from the minute we arrived until the minute we left we were provided with courteous and attentative service from all staff. Prior to arriving, I checked reviews on Trip Advisor regularly and I have to admit I had some trepidation to continue with my booking as some reviews were quite negative. However, these worries were totally unjustified . The hotel is of 5* quality, the check in was smooth and all staff respectful and courteous at all times. Breakfast was included in our package and I have to say, was plentiful, with opportunity to eat as much as you liked from over 100 choices! Again, staff at breakfast were continually asking if anything else was needed and replenishment of beverages was instantaneous. As for the location, admittedly the hotel was located on a steep hill which could be difficult for some but there was a bus stop right outside the hotel and taxis were plentiful and reasonably priced. Just at the bottom of the hill, approx 10 mins walking distance, was a large choice of restautants to suit everybodies budget. All in all - a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “creditable and formal hotel useful for businessmans and diplomat”
Reviews.Author: Arash56
Reviews.Content: This is my first travel to istanbul by my family and my little children.it seems that Conrad hotel is famous and protagonist hotel in istanbul. I was very research for hotels before travel and I choosed this hotel from all. reception was very accessible and active but a little oblivious. me and my wife reserved a room for ourself they give us a room with 2 seprated bed!!! we have little children but they put us in smoke free floor!!! furnitures and accouterments was shapely but with some rusty.there was some different between pictures on the website with true view. security and safety was very high and excellent, servants was very good, every where was clean. breakfast and foods was excellent.entertainments was not useful for families. hotel is in nice position in the city but far from spectacular and shopping places. there is nice hotel but I'll never return over there.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad: Hilton quality like in the USA”
Reviews.Author: Moffringa
Reviews.Content: As a former ferquent guest of the Hilton hotels this is how i remember the quality of Hilton,personal attention and top notch in everything. This Conrad hotel fits it all and to be honest the next time i check into Istanbul,Turkey,this hotel is going to be my base from were i travel to other places in this great country.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel away from tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: ChitownCF
Reviews.Content: The staff treated us beautifully and the views were exceptional. Our problem was that we had two days by ourselves to see the sites and we were too far from many attractions and were constantly in traffic. Cleanliness, service, food quality were all outstanding. I would stay closer to the sites next time.

Reviews.Title: “3G - Great Location, Great Service, Great Accomodation...”
Reviews.Author: MistikTraveler
Reviews.Content: I always use this hotel for my annual visits to my beautiful birth city, Istanbul. Hotel is located in the heart of the city. Within walking distance, you can go to many hip places. (Dolmabahce Palace, Taksim Square, Nisantasi Shopping District, Ortakoy, and ferries for sightseeing. Hotel's staff is extremely professional, and very kind. All amenities are considered for picky and needy travelers. There is luxury of a high end hotel, and comfort of your house. It is very safe, and clean. Food is incredible! Breakfast is impeccable! I have been staying at this hotel for the last two years, and will continue to choose it in my future stays as well...

Reviews.Title: “Best Views of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: emrerendedotcom
Reviews.Content: The conrad is one of the best hotels in Istanbul. It obviously comes with all the ameneties of a 5 star hotel (immaculate rooms, gym, pool etc..) but it is the 14th floor bar and restaurant that draws everyone here, Istanbulians and tourists alike. The view from the 14th floor is a 360 degree panorama of Istanbul with the entire Bosphorus at your feet and and sipping cocktails here during and after sunset is a pleasure that is hard to beat. The suites if you can afford them are worth the extra penny as you get balconies overlooking the sea.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Phil-Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel near the Bosphorus, view from rooftop just spectacular; all services top notch; only issue was hotel taxis tend to overcharge

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pegasustr
Reviews.Content: Conrad is the member of Hilton group hotels and better than other 2 Hilton's. It is positioned higher segment. It's location is quite good close to the bridge to cross to Asia or just few minutes walk to take ferry or boats to go to Asia. It is in Besiktas area that is one of the lively central areas. quite safe 7 x 24 walking around is OK. Good food is in all directions as well as shopping within few kilometers. hotel has several room categories where cheastst is lower level city view and higest is bigger rooms in higer floors with bosphorus view. I stayed all of these and would recommend higher floors either view. Breakfast is also lovely much better than any other 5 star hiltons around europe. People are quite freindly and really keen to help and usually offers free upgrades to better rooms (it might be related with Hiltonhonnors program) some rooms with bosphorus view might be smaller due to architecture of the building. It is a good option if you could not find one hotel in Asian side as it is the easiest location to go to Asia from European part.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: beuleu
Reviews.Content: as expected for an hotel of this category but a little bit far from center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: westmorland
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night pre and 2 nights post Turkey tour. Large hotel, very comfortable with all the extras you would expect from a 5* hotel. Along with this goes the prices you would expect from a 5* hotel. I have to say that I think in this day and age the 27 T.Lira fee for 1 hour wifi internet use was rather steep- I think its something that you should expect to be part and parcel of the room rate, after all what does it cost them to supply it? If breakfast is not inclued in your room rate this could set you back about 45 T.Lira We had 2 different rooms- 1st one had a bath and a separate shower, 2nd had only a bath. Both were very comfortable, and nicely furnished. The 2nd one was showing signs of age especially in the bathroom, where there was considerable mould around the bath. One dissapointment was that on our last day the outdoor pool closed to guests at 5pm for a private function. It was a beautiful evening and we were looking forward to a swim after a hard days sightseeing, but had to make do with the very inadequate indoor pool- we weren't best pleased ! Short walk down the hill from the hotel is the Bosthorous with plenty of shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleFlower
Reviews.Content: This stay was amazing. Hotel redefines luxury, one of a kind in Istanbul. All facilities were state-of-the art and staff were extremely helpful (spoke multiple language). The views of the city / bosphorous are breath-taking. One of a few to have this benefit. Rooms were very nice, flat HD TVs, comfortable, clean. The hotel is very green/ environ friendly, almost too much. I mean I'm not going to read every note you put in my room (they were several, and one said be green / don't change sheets unless you place card on bed, ofcourse I didn't realize this.) Anyways, didn't bother to call was too tired.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest view over the Bosporus”
Reviews.Author: duenksischott
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in Istanbul, offering a magnificient view over the Bosporus. A very nice Luxourious Hotel in Istanbul, next to the Bosporus and the Bosporus Bridge. magnificient view over the city and the sea. One of the most beatiful Hilton Hotels I ever met. God for Business and Private trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shame about the service..”
Reviews.Author: UkTulip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good condition and the amenities and bedrooms are truly excellent. However the positive stops there. Upon arrival staff at reception were unhelpful and unwilling to sort out a mix up with the reservation. After arguing for about 30 minutes I was assured that it was all sorted. However reception had failed to pass on the relevant information and we had to validate our stay every day. I was ignored for nearly 10 minutes in the business centre by the member of staff who was on a phonecall and again wasn't very helpful. The food at breakfast was outstanding but again had to ask twice to get tea refilled. An outstanding hotel but it obviously has some staff who are unmotivated and not very helpful but a big shame considering its not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad nice people and good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: faroon1219
Reviews.Content: The Conrad wasoverall a nice hotel with excellent breakfast buffet. Because my wife and I like to walk to explore a city and for some excercise the location was fine. About 25 minute walk to Kabatas tram station and that takes you to all the sights and stops Watch out for taxis though. Itseemed taxis from the conrad to a location were fine but the exact same trip back always was significantly more. I think that the Conrad has their own taxis from the hotel which were more fairly priced.The staff were very nice and helpful. Go to Istanbulhotelstransfer.com for reasonable rates from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference several floors make”
Reviews.Author: tucsonishome
Reviews.Content: In all fairness, I wrote a review that was not so good toward this hotel just a day or so ago. Again when we got here the room we had on the 5th floor was really not up to the standard which I believe I have had at other Hiltons in Europe. We continued to speak to the younger ladies at the desk that really didn't help much. Once we got the manager involved and explained that this was not what we had expected from this Hilton. We were moved in a day from the 5th floor.....really poor quality to the 15th and the concierge floor. It looked and felt as if we had actually moved hotels! The difference is like night and day. The 15th floor is just beautiful and the rooms are modern and clean. Once up on the 15th floor it also seemed that they want to help in every way and go out of their way to accomodate and address your issues. My point is, why did it take a day and calling the manager to get things done right? It has changed my opionion that I wrote earlier but things should never get this far in the first place. You must keep asking for what you really want to make you stay a memorable experience. If we had just accepted what we had we would have been unhappy during our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great View; BUT!!”
Reviews.Author: WWJTraveling
Reviews.Content: We had four wonderful days in Istanbul, but the Conrad was a disappointment. The reception area and lobby are the highlight. Our room had a great view looking towards the Golden Horn; but was extremely worn and tired. The breakfast dining area was grand, but looked out on a pool area which was dirty with sea gulls bathing in the pools uninviting water. The breakfast prices were high and the service spotty. We had no problem with walking a few short blocks to the take a taxi to the tram to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Joke”
Reviews.Author: designtiger
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband who uses this hotel when he goes to Istanbul for business as he gets corporate rates - intended stay was four nights. We had prebooked a standard room and were the only people at check-in but it took some time as nothing had been prepared for our arrival. We had asked for a nice and quiet room with a view and the receptionist offered us a business room (+â‚¬30/night) or a room on the executive floors (+â‚¬50/night), of course, we could also take a look at a standard room. When we got to there we were very surprised to find a dated and smallish room/bathroom, smelly and with worn stained carpets. Due to the slight S-shape of the hotel the "views" were directed to its own facade. In our opinion it would have been difficult to pick a worse room and quite frankly we did not feel we were valued clients at all ! Following this experience and as the position of the hotel is suboptimal for tourists we decided more or less on the spot to look for another place to stay and checked out within the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Top Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hande_M
Reviews.Content: Conrad is a fantastic top class hotel! The staff were excellent, always very nice and curteous and willing to help. The breakfast was tasty and plenty of choices. The rooms were spacious and clean and it had a lovely roof terrace with pleanty of excellent views...but be warned the prices of the drinks in the terrace bar were very expensive, a diet coke was 17Turkish Lira (Â£7.50), but in my opinion, worth it for its lovely views. My only one gripe would be the location, its not too far in distance by taxi to Taksim and Sultanahmet area but the traffic was a killer!! However, we found a nice way to get to Sultanahmet (area with the mosques and covered bazaar) area, you exit the hotel, walk downhill (5Mins) to the water taxi port of Besiktas, catch a boat to Uskudar and from there catch a boat to Eminonu which is 5 mins walk from Aya Sofya and Blue mosque, views on the boats are excellent and it costs 1.5Turkish Lira (70p) each way!

Reviews.Title: “The view and the staff make up for the prices...”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: First add the fifth star if money isn't an object for you. It's a great hotel. The cons: The location is a bit away from most everything and is up a steep hill making walking back after a day of being out a pain. It's a ways away from any public transport, so taxi is going to be your mode of transport. Costs for everything are exorbitant - a coke in the bar is 12 TL, one from your mini-bar is 14 TL. Internet is crazy expensive - 48 TL / day and not that fast, there is a 59 TL business option that isn't much faster. However - The people are great. My family joined me after a couple of days and I asked to be moved to a room with a view. They didn't have any available the first day I asked but to check back. Asked the second morning and said they still had nothing, but people were leaving that afternoon and to check back. Didn't think about it until we got back to the hotel at 21:30, a message was waiting for me, the desk ask if I wanted to move rooms. I'm a Hilton gold (not diamond) member and expected to go to an executive floor, but they sent us to the 5th floor. Turns out it was just the most amazing view of the Bosphorous. Stunning way just to sit and watch the ships. The 15th floor executive lounge and 14th floor bar have the same amazing view. Restaurants were quite good, breakfast was included with our rate and there was a nice selection. Laundry is another very expensive item, but two items that I sent out happened to need mending and they did the mending at no additional cost which was greatly appreciated. The room designers knew what they were doing, the curtains are on separate tracks that overlap, meaning you don't get that annoying stab of light in the early morning, big kudos on that. AC was cold enough to make it snow. Shower/bathroom were fine. Beds were very good with a selection of pillows. Need something - call for it. There are quite a selection of little shops across the road and some good kebap and fish places at the bottom of the hill (400m or so away). There's a public basketball court out front and a private tennis court as well as indoor / outdoor swimming pool. There's a nice little park with some neat exercise equipment that seemed to get a lot of use. All in all a very good experience. You're buying location and the service. The staff remembered my name, spoiled my son and took great care of us. If somebody else is paying, I'm staying...

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Goodsailing
Reviews.Content: This one has it all. Great views. Great business center. Comfortable rooms. Fabulous staff. Excellent food. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good option for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MAB430
Reviews.Content: This is a large, very "American" feeling hotel in a good part of Istanbul. The rooms are nice, all facilities very good and the bar on the top has an outstanding view and 'vibe' and it may be the best part of staying at this hotel. The only downside is the location, while in a decent location is not very convenient to the metro and you will be taking taxi's which in Istanbul can be a hassle because they always try and rip you off. Overall, I'd say this is a good opption and I would consider staying here again but might also try another option next time for comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has Great Views, But Far from Sights”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over Easter weekend after we booked the January Sale offer which was a great price including breakfast. Based on the TripAdvisor reviews, we chose to upgrade to a Bosphorus view room, which I agree, was a good choice, especially since it wasn't much more. We arrived late on a Thursday night. The hotel has a lot of security, like hotels in the MIddle East, where all cabs are checked before coming near the hotel and you and your luggage go through a metal detector/screening. I felt safe though, so no issues with this. We were initially okay with the fact that we were 'upgraded' to a business room, while the desk clerk told us that they had pushed 2 beds together as we had requested one bed when we made our reservation. We thought this would be okay, especially since it was an upgrade, but as you'll see from the photo, it was just a bit odd. They did tell us that we could move rooms the next day but as we had big bags since this was the first leg of a long trip, and we were only staying 3 nights, we thought it wasn't worth the hassle. The business room didn't offer any 'upgraded' amenities and the closet was really small, big enough for one business person probably. Typical Hilton room, nice enough, but rather bland, no personality. The view was great though and we loved the little window sill/seat area as well. You can't open the windows too far, but my husband was able to get a few photos. The breakfast buffet was slightly above average, but there was a huge variety of options and generally things were kept hot, even when we arrived late. Each day we were able to find enough to eat that we only needed a small snack before dinner. Service in this area was pretty good. The hotel is located approximately 30 minutes from the airport. I had heard horror stories about cabs in Istanbul overcharging, but our meter was accurate and was even less than I had expected (about 35 lira/â‚¬17). After exploring the city over the next 2 days, I would not recommend this hotel for its location. While itâ€™s manageable and the hotel does offer amazing views over the river, it was a hassle to get to most of the sights. It would likely be about â‚¬15 to take a cab into Sultanahmet, where most of the sights are, we only did that once when going to dinner. The other times we walked approximately a mile and a half to the last tram station. Then it was a 15 minute ride to the sights. The first time it was a bit difficult to figure out the payment system as itâ€™s not in English and the machines only accept coins, but once we had change, this was a very inexpensive and easy way to get into town. Taking a cab from this last tram station back to the hotel was a steal at approximately â‚¬3, and saving at least 20 minutes of walking, part of it up a big hill to the hotel. While there is a busy street just a 5 minute walk from the hotel, none of the shops and restaurants would be of interest to a tourist, except perhaps for a quick snack. A cab was necessary to go out to dinner. The hotel itself is grand and opulent and the public areas are well-done. I especially liked the roof-top terrace bar which offered great views of the river. They had a unique drink and bar menu and while pricey, the drinks and steak sandwich I had were both good. While open-air, the roof could be closed off by glass, but also had heat lamps and the waiters offered blankets as well. There was a DJ there both nights we went as well. We found the concierge to be awful. I worked with several guys there and each offered just the basic info, almost rehearsed, no additional tips or insider information. Most disappointingly, one night we didnâ€™t want to go all the way into Sultanahmet for dinner so we asked the concierge for a recommendation for a traditional Turkish restaurant nearby, they wrote down a name for us. It was pouring rain outside so we asked for an umbrella and they said they were all gone. We then got a cab in front of the hotel, the bellman telling the driver the restaurant name, then there was an exchange in Turkish back and forth and we were off. After driving around for almost 30 minutes (it was clear our driver had no idea where he was going) and after speaking up several times, although he didnâ€™t speak English, he finally understood enough to stop and ask for directions. My husband finally spotted the sign for the place and we realized that it was not right off the street but a good walk back towards the river. So we had to run through the rain only to stumble into a very fancy restaurant (all the waiters were in tuxedos) and immediately turn around as we saw we were seriously underdressed. We later learned that this restaurant was not even 2km from our hotel, so after the long and expensive cab ride, no umbrella, the horrible recommendation from the concierge as we were very casually dressed and the poor information from the bellman to the cab driver, this was a huge disappointment of a night. The next morning we spoke to the manager to share our experience so hopefully they could improve the situation. He was a bit defensive but overall professional and handled the situation well by leaving a long note in our room as well as some treats. They also arranged a complimentary transfer to the airport -- which because of traffic got us there just 25 minutes before our flight left, but we still made it! -- so overall we were happy that they addressed the situation and tried to make up for the inconvenience. My recommendation would be to be careful with the concierge here (which i usually am at any hotel) and service-wise, it's not on par with other 5-stars. Travel tip: Definitely recommend a Bosphorus cruise, but when you get on the boat, go on the left side. We sat on the right and while we thought that we would see everything as the boat obviously turns around, the boat goes really close to shore, so only if you're on the left side of the boat (which after leaving port turns to be the right side), you're really far from shore as opposed to being able to see everything on shore close up on the other side. It fills up and it's hard to move around as it's really narrow on the sides.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, expensive, close to port, far from airport”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior71
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Conrad Istanbul is a very nice modern hotel. It's close to the center of the city and within an easy walk of the port. Security is tight with metal detectors at the entrance but I notice this is true for pretty much all commercial buildings and hotels in Istanbul. My only major gripe is that they don't include free wifi access. When you pay 240euros a night, I don't like it when they try to get a little more. But they did throw in a very nice breakfast buffet and the room was roomy, comfortable, and quiet. I liked their fitness center with a swimming pool and hot tub although the water in the hot tub wasn't hot. I found that the best way to get around Istanbul is by ferry. Traffic can be horrible - my taxi in from the airport at 6pm took about 1h 15m. But you can take ferries across the Bosphorus Straits (separating European Istanbul from Asian Istanbul) for about $1 each way. You can also take a ferry from close to the Conrad to the Old Town (Haggia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace). If you're brave enough to rent a car, some ferries also take cars over. I highly recommend a visit to the Haggia Sophia. It was built as a church in 527AD, converted to a mosque by the Ottamans some time around the 11th century AD and it's now a museum. Awe inspiring building and architecture but take a guide or guide book with you since no audio tours are available. Of course, it was also featured in the James Bond movie - "From Russia with Love" My next recommendation would be the Topkapi Palace. You can easily spend several hours here so set aside at least half a day to do it justice. The cistern by the Haggia Sophia is another worthwhile attraction. It was one of six cisterns built by the Romans in what was then Constantinople. Other than the engineering feat of moving water from miles away using nothing but gravity, it also features columns that were used in pagan temples that were torn down when the Roman Empire converted to Christianity. Don't miss the two columns with Medusa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location & Nice Views”
Reviews.Author: VolcanoGroupie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Bosphurus view room on the 5th floor during the last week of March 2010. Check in and check out were easy. The room was a little better than average - terrific view of the Bosphurus, decent bathroom, in room safe, bathrobes and slippers, clock radio, and nice flat screen TV with channels from all over the world (China, Italy, Turkey, US, Britain, Germany). The 14th floor bar/restaurant was my favorite . I thought $25 for a cheeseburger, fries and several cokes was worth it as the views of the Bosphurus Bridge and the mosques of Sultanahmet were gorgeous. When I first arrived I was concerned the hotel was out of the way, but I grew to like it as it sits just off of a neighborhood street. There was a steep walk from the hotel down to the street, but there were a number of small markets, fast food restaurants (including KFC, Pizza Hut and McDonalds) and Starbucks nearby. The hotel had a concierge desk which booked tours as well as a desk where you could exchange Euros and USD (including travelers checks) for Turkish Lira. The gift shop on the second floor was very small but had some nice souvenirs. The staff was professional. While I was there, I had an issue with a taxi driver near the Archeology Museum who cheated me out of $140 USD. I asked the Manager of Guest Services at the Conrad to assist me in filing a complaint with the taxi union, and she graciously did so. In sum, I thought the hotel was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. nothing more to be said”
Reviews.Author: Shuttie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in a great location. The bar is well worth the visit, great views, good service and nice food. Rooms are nice, clean and fairly well maintained. Great Breakfast. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorous from the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: KSBan
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location both in terms of access to other places and scenic view. The hotel rooms were excellent and the food quality was superlative. The service of the staff was extremely courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is always good”
Reviews.Author: SIYI53
Reviews.Content: Dear all, checked in on 6am and I booked the room from the 11th (altough it was already 11 FEB), the guy at the reception said that I had to pay for an extra night as I cannot get into the room now, I can understand this, so I said how much do I have to pay then extra, he explained he did not know, but will arrange a good price (typical Turkish). We have been upgraded directly to executive floor ( I am Diamond Hhonors member). Room was good as all other conrad hotels I;ve visited (Bangkok, Hong Kong, Brussels). Although the rooms were very warm, and I could get the temperature under control (in the night it was anoying). Breakfast was good, afternoon stuff as well and the evening canape's were great, all day alcohol drinks (wine and beers) so that was more then we expected and after 17:00 hours also cocktails and heavy drinks (gin, whiskey, Raki etc) till 23:00 hours. Employees were great and will definitily stay there again next time visiting Istanbul. Their sushi is not that well (Summit restaurants 14th floor) but views are unbelievable, also from the executive lounge (15th floor). regards, S

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel, Safe & comfortable as you would expect but not very exciting”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBD
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel during a business trip. The Hotel is run reasonably efficiently (although my colleague had problems with room service) the staff were courteous but could be a little more enthusiastic. Unusually for me I chose to eat most evenings in the Hotel, using room service. The food is of a very high standard and reasonably priced - except breakfast 40TL for continental and 50TL Cooked breakfast. My room was a 'business style' , standard sized with king bed @ 160 EUR per night. I was here on business and because of the bad weather I didn't do any of the touristy stuff, so can't really comment on the location of the Hotel in relation to main tourist sites, although I think it was quite a hike from the Blue Mosque. The area felt safe, mostly residential , with a few small general shops nearby and some familiar fast food outlets. I would recommend going up to the roof terrace for some great views across the Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views of Istanbul with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: vagabond2010
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the end of our 10 day stay all was exceptional. Being upgraded to the Executive floor is a must in this hotel as the views and the service are second to none. The staff tries very hard to please with sincerity. Their warmth will not be forgotten. Thank you for helping to make our vacation a great success.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from place you want to visit”
Reviews.Author: Hoyamd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in March of 09. Due to flight delays we arrived on day late to find out that our bosphorus view room was not available despite the fact that we prepaid for the whole trip on Orbitz (including the night we missed because of our delay). The front desk office was not accommodating at all and it took 1 hour on the phone with orbitz and they got us the room we requested on our second night. The breakfast buffet was great and the new room had amazing views. The hotel is very far from all the touristy places in town and Taxi fare cost about $ 30 dollars each way. The concierge barely spoke english and his recommendations for restaurants were all so bad we stopped talking to him. Unless you have a conference at the hotel, I would skip it and stay near Sultan Ahmet or Taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agatestone
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three children in a one bedroom suite with a view of the Bosphorus. I tried to book interconnecting rooms but they gave us a reduced price on the suite. It was fabulous and breakfast at the top of the hotel was included. Swimming pool was good too once the sightseeing was over. Only downside was the transfer quoted at the hotel was very expensive. We arrange our transfer through http://www.istanbulhotelstransfer.com/ or www.istanbulairporttransfer.net (same company). Very easy to use, reliable and friendly and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Some letdowns, some highpoints.”
Reviews.Author: annchgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the beginning of our trip and 2 days at the end. The room for our first stay was okay. It was an end suite, but the room felt dated with sea foam green and mauve decor. The shower stall (separate from the tub) was small and had mildew in it. We did very much enjoy the breakfast and happy hour on the rooftop, which has great views and we were generally happy with the executive lounge. The room for our second stay was much better. It was not a suite, but the furnishings were updated and the bathroom was mildew free. Our only compaint is that our interactions with either concierge was less than satisfactory. Both concierges seemed to lack information, lack willingness to find out information, and were generally unhelpful and rude. I was completely blown away by this, since I expect the concierge to epitomize the service of any hotel with high standards. I would also warn that this hotel is a bit far from most of the sites; however, we enjoyed it for this reason. It does mean lots of cabs, etc., to get around town, though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, breathtaking views, and uber helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DCR0adWarri0r
Reviews.Content: From when we arrived, and were directed to the Executive Floor for check-in, after being upgraded with my HHonors Gold status, I knew it would be an amazing stay. And whe we arrived in our room on the 12th floor, and were greeted with the view, I didn't want to check-out! There is even a Clefs D'or Concierge waiting to help in the lobby waiting to help with everything and anything. On day 2 of our 7 night stay, the staff in the Executive Lounge greeted me by name - that's tremendous, considering the movement of guests at a large property. I can't decide if the food, or the views from the patio on the 14th floor were better, but we returned daily for breakfast. The hotel is situated in a park like setting, and has all the bells and whistles of a Conrad. A friend who was visiting from ZRH joined us for drinks one night and said "I thought Conrad was just a dusty old HIlton Brand, but WOW this place is amazing" and I agree 110%. The best kept secret about the hotel? The mens room on the 14 th floor in the restaurant has urinals that when you're using them, you're looking out a floor to ceiling window with an amazing view of Kabatas and the Bosphorus, all at the same time. I'll never stay anywhere but the Conrad when I return to IST.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJstacwa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of the city from rooftop restaurant. Room was very clean and comfortable. Check-in/out very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Monsterious Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: edfunder
Reviews.Content: We were booked here as part of a tour. It a huge hotel for conventions and tour groups -- meaning long lines and unanswered phone calls. Both check in and departure were about 10-15 waits. Breakfast was a buffet and wasn't horrible, but not great. It was almost impossible to get a waiter to bring you tea or coffee. Rooms: Were fine and clean. Bed was comfortable. Bath was small but clean. Internet was not free in hotel and was approx $30us a day - but it would kick you off if you weren't continuously using it. The good thing about this hotel was they gave you free bottled water. Another bad is that the elevators were slow.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ElenaTa
Reviews.Content: Great first impression of the hotel! Beautiful interiors, friendly staff, great amenities, large room, comfortable beds and very very clean! Great location in Istanbul if you are a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: NayarDubai
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is old, it was a great memorable stay at the hotel Conrad, The place is impeccable clean. The location of the hotel is just great, little away from the bustle but well placed and the staff are so courteous , that we are seriously planning to make one more trip in near future. The tours organised by Mercan tours ( arranged by Emirates) were par excellent! Everything is so nostalgic about the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: LizzyRoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before we flew home. Hotel seemed very full and we were "upgraded" to the business floor. The rooms are very good with stunning views, the food is good with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “great service, but the place needs better maintenance”
Reviews.Author: psychtrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Conrad in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly, service was impeccable. However, the carpets were worn out, and the bathroom needed renewal. I had to change rooms because of a water leakage in my first room. I received apologies, but nothing more. The price of internet connection in the room is way to high, about 25 â‚¬ per day.

Reviews.Title: “Always treated well and with respect.”
Reviews.Author: conferenceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days while in Istanbul. The service was very good.. However, I think the rooms could have been maintained a little better. My colleague had a leak in her room, and I knew several other guests had to change rooms. Rooms were quiet, except for that we could hear other toilets flush. I thought the staff was very courteous with an eye on service. We had a two twin bed room but they were shoved together as one King bed which was not what was pictured on their website. We enjoyed eating at the restaurant several times. For breakfast it was 45TL and was very good, and dinner they had a special huge buffet for Ramaazan and it was 80TL we also ate Ala carte and enjoyed room service once. All were good service and the food was excellent. I think if I stayed again, I would probably have chosen one of the options with breakfast included - It was good, with good service and if your ordered it up front, it was much less expensive. The hotel is in area of town called Besiktas. This area does not have many tourist things in it except for Dolmanche Palace and the Naval Museum. Both are walkable but a good hike down a tall hill. At the bottom of the hill there is also a ferry station that will take you both the Asian side and the Golden Horn area. If you were looking to be near more things, I would suggest Taksim Square - but the views were wonderful from the Conrad - especially from the Summit Lounge on Floor 14. You can see all of the Bophorous and I would suggest viewing it both by night and by day. The drinks were expensive 20TL for a well drink, 30TL for one made with premium spirits - but the views are worth it. Pluses would be: Service They have their own cabs who were courteous and honest. Views from the Summit Lounge. You can earn Hilton Honors points. They gym was spectacular with Precor equipment, headphones provided, modern weights, and a great steam room. There are local restaurants and Starbucks coffee on the road in front of the hotel (if you miss home). Also, at the bottom of the hill Besiktas shopping area is where locals shop - not as touristy and a great opportunities to buy things at discounted prices. Good local restaurants as well. Minuses would be: location in relation to many tourist destinations (About 25 TL to things like Blue Mosque or Spice Market). The steep hill it was on makes it less walkable. (but that is Istanbul - it is a city of 7 hills). I would stay here again, because I felt safe and respected here = but maybe would choose something else in Taksim square for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, OK location”
Reviews.Author: AirMarc
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was busy, and a bit lacking on personal service. We were on the concierge level, which helped a bit, but had trouble getting a good room. The views are beyond belief. It is located up on a hill. Rooms themselves were nice. There are places to eat nearby, and a laundry across the street (that will do laundry by the pound -- if you're on the road for 6 weeks like we were) Istanbul itself was incredible -- would have liked a hotel with a better location though. A caution -- the Hilton web site has the Conrad location as being in the old part of Istanbul -- it is not. You are going to need to cab it in, or make a 20 minute walk to catch up with the end of the tram system to get in to town, or take the ferry, which does not run all that often.

Reviews.Title: “Best city break ever”
Reviews.Author: nevcat
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the Conrad hotel, and we had a fantastic trip. The location of the hotel is contrary to what some have written, really well placed, unless you limit your Istanbul visit to Sultanahmet, which would be unfortunate, as Istanbul has so much more to offer that the Blue Mosque (which, incidentally, is a must-see). You can be at the Besiktas port, or other small ports within 15 mins, or take a taxi, inexpensive wherever you go, take the Funicular up to Taksim, or the tramway, all within 15 mins. The room was an excective room, and apart from the violet walls in the bathroom (unusual choice) it was really beautiful. Every day, Conrad brought us new things for our room, free water etc, newspapers etc, so the staff pay great attention to detail. The breakfast was great on the exec floor, but this is especially because of the beautiful view. The surrounding area includes Dolmebahce palace and Besiktas stadium, boat trips and also Ortakoy, recommended to us by the hotel staff, which is a fantastic square with the most romantic view of the bridge (rivals the eiffel tower when lit up at night!) and great trendy restaurants. In Istanbul, you have to appreciate the diversity to enjoy it to the full, so hanging out with the young & trendy is as much part of Istanbul today as being in the old town. So for me, Conrad is the perfect place to stay, and if you go in summertime, the outdoor pool is a dream. Some people have referred to the high costs of the Conrad, but if you get a good deal on the website, you can enjoy an exceptional hotel for a great deal. I would go there again for business (though it is a shame waking up with the Bosphorus view on your own!) and definitely for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: AndreaParodi
Reviews.Content: Good location. Perfect staff. Excellent hotel for leisure and business

Reviews.Title: “An upsclae hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: Legaldds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple night. I suggest you book an executive room. Even if you get a city view, the access to Executive Lounge makes up for it. The panoramic view from the lounge is breathtaking. The staff at executive lounge were very curteous, and you can check in on 15th floor to bypass the lines in the lobby. The room itself was nicely decorated but bath room is average. While the hotel is on top of a hill, it is a short walk down to the pier and Cirgan Palace, and a little longer walk to Dolmabache Palace. This is a grerat hotel fro relaxation and enjoying views. If you have a short time in Istanbul and just wanted to see hostoric signs, you might be better off staying in Sultan ahmet region, otherwise Conrad is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Conrad standard”
Reviews.Author: suitdude30
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Conrad Istanbul, the fountains, acres of marble, and very elegant, high-ceilinged and domed lobby creates very high expectations. However, upon arriving in the room (I stayed there at the beginning and end of my tour of Turkey), those expectations were not met, as the decor is dated, with many obvious signs of poor maintenance, such as curtains hanging loose from rails, peeling wallpaper, and chipped paint on skirting boards. Carpet in both the rooms and the corridors were grubby and showed their age. Room and corridors on the Executive Floors have been refurbished, however, but you'll be paying a lot more to stay on those floors. On the positive side, the beds were very comfortable, enhanced by very soft and silky sheets. An LCD TV is the only nod to modernity. Note that twin beds are singles, not doubles (or even queens in the most generous hotels). The majority of rooms either face the small park/playground at the front of the hotel, or the surrounding neighbourhood. For a significant surcharge, one can upgrade to a room with a view of the spectacular Bosphorus Straits. The buffet breakfast in the main restaurant is adequate, but certainly not up to the over-the-top standards set by Asian establishments. The scrambled eggs appeared to have been made from a powdered formula, and tasted strange, hence I stuck to the hard-boiled eggs. On the whole, staff should be trained to smile a little more, be it at Reception or the restaurant. The Conrad is situated uphill in the residential quarter of Besiktas, which I was told was a very posh area, although it didn't look particularly upscale. A 10 minute walk downhill will take you to the waterfront and a maze of restaurants and shops, although you'd need to take a 10-15 minute taxi ride to reach the historical centre of Sultanahmet, where the Haiga Sophia, Topkapi Palace and other cultural treasures are situated. Having experienced the Conrad properties in Singapore and Hong Kong, their Istanbul sister falls short of the high standards set by the Asian properties, although not significantly. Would I return? Undecided.

Reviews.Title: “Seems good located and service is top notch”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: stayed there foir 2 nights and got a business room at the 12th floor with executive lounge access. the rooms are really nice, large and well equipped. The staff is friendly and over above average hotel staff i meet in general. the excutive floor on the top floor is really nice and the view over the city is really cool and as well the top floor restaurant is nice with a good view. Can really recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, expensive internet!”
Reviews.Author: PharmaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Conrad Istanbul last week and enjoyed the hotel bery much. My single complaint regards the high speed internet that was exhorbitantly priced so much so that I preferred to use ny cellular internet connection. What I noticed later was that there are two price plans to choose from - both expensive though - so if you need the internet find the one priced less. The hotel is in Besiktas on a hill overlooking the Bosphorus and the bridge between Europe and Asia, so there is a grand view from the 14th floor bar, especially at night (open until 2AM). The hotel is pretty secluded when it comes to sights so taxis are needed to get anywhere, however they are abundant and this is not a deterrent. The service in the hotel was exemplary at all hours and at all stations including the front desk, concierge, breakfast, Summit bar and housekeeping. I did not have a chance to use the pool or fitness room but they exist and look good. Hotel costs are not low but they are definitely not the highest to pay for a really nice 5* hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a Queen there!”
Reviews.Author: karenrefah
Reviews.Content: Dont miss the breckfast and eat pool side! The President of Turkey stayed there while we were there. So must be great! This hotel has alot of security. Front gate your car will be scanned. Every time you enter the hotel you go through security check. The rooms are quite. The lobby is very beautiful with a nice fountain, and a grand staircase. Dont make overseas calls from your room. I paid $200 for a 5 min. call. Do go up to the terrace bar, awsome view!!

Reviews.Title: “good but very pricey, far from all touristy attractions”
Reviews.Author: galinav
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel, with spacious rooms and great views. Beaware: 1) if you book with expedia and choose the cheapest fare (about $140), the breakfast is not included, and if you want to add it you will have to pay outrageous 35 euros. 2) Internet is CRAZILY EXPENSIVE! It's 60 liras ($40) a day! 3) It's far away from the old town, Taksim, Galata Tower, etc. There is no obvious public transportation (i.e. tram) right next to the hotel, so if you are planning to do any sightseeing - you will most likely take cabs (which are not very expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great views”
Reviews.Author: peter0001
Reviews.Content: Other contributors to Trip Advisor did not rate this hotel that highly, but our experience was top notch. The staff is as helpful as any hotel in the world. The hotel is clearly a 5 star property with outstanding views of the Bosphorus. There is a great pool and two tennis courts on the property and a world class exercise facility. The 14th floor has an outdoor breakfast and cocktail area with spectacular views of the Bosphorus and the sunset in the evening. The hotel is a ten minute taxi ride from the old town area with the Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. Others wrote about the taxis ripping you off. I didn't find this at all. The doorman would tell the taxi driver where you want to go and I wrote down the Conrad address to show a taxi driver for the return trip. I took at least ten taxis and all were much cheaper than any large city in the US. Change your currency to the Turkish Lira at the airport and you will have no issues as the taxi meters are in Turkish lira. Less than a ten minute walk down to the Bosphorus and you are at a main dock and can pick up a boat taking you to the mouth of the Dead Sea. Great trip to take; very scenic along the shores - mansions to fishing villages on the cruise. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Business Meeting - Some Oddities”
Reviews.Author: panthergirl
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the Conrad. Room was lovely with a nice view of the Bosphorus. Bed was very comfy (although SINGLE, which was the first oddity). The food in the hotel, from the main restaurant, was great. Not just good, great. The food upstairs at the Summit rooftop bar was less than good. But the drinks... mmmm. Now for the oddities. The hotel appears to be highly secure. They checked under my taxi with mirrors when I arrived from the airport. You have to go through an x-ray scanner each time you enter the hotel. However, there were FOUR instances where my room key did not work. I went to the front desk, gave them my room #, they told ME my name and I said yes. They handed me the key, no further questions asked. I became very sick (food poisoning from, we think, a restaurant we went to on Friday night). Guest Services listed a doctor and nurse on site. When I enquired, I was told "Oh, that's for employees only." ?? The service was overall very good, but there were several times where I felt invisible as a woman (this was true of my entire visit to Istanbul). Men would walk right in front of me as I waited to check in, or to give the restaurant hostess my room #. I don't need chivalry, but common courtesy is something I've become accustomed to. The pool area was lovely, the concierge very helpful, and overall I had a good experience at the hotel. It is not close to the touristy stuff (but close to Orkotoy which is a high-toned area to have dinner and go dancing). We took a 40 minute cab ride into the Old City one day and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fab View of the bay & bridge”
Reviews.Author: notyalc
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Istanbul & we were accomodated at the Corad hotel all our procedures upon check in wer quite quick. We headed straight for our first meal after our flight. Themeal organised was an indian meal since our groug was indian. Much to my ashtonisment it was prepared well & was much appreciated by the rest of our group as well. I am much of an adventurer & was quite dissapointed with an indian meal. The hotel is quite welll located & all the sights & snds of istanbul are near. for dinner we dinned at the summit restaurant which is loacted on the top floor. This was a private dinner organised by our team & was accompanied with a turkish wine tasting. One drawback i faced with the hotel was abt 90% of the staff were not too comfortable with english & it was really difficult to get the message across to them. This lead to alot of goof ups. The summit restaurant had a terrace & windows all across the indoor area. had a fablulous view of the bridge which kept changing its color throught the night. My room was neat & clean. Quite average. But the view was above average. Besides the language barrier i feel this hotel is a good pick for business conference & so on!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice 5 star hotel with gorgeous views from rooftop”
Reviews.Author: skhMontreal_Quebec
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a few nights at this hotel as I was part of a group tour. I found it to be a beautiful hotel to stay, with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel, including a huge variety- filled buffet breakfast. The dinners looked delicious as well from what I can tell when peaking in on one of their dining rooms on the main level (facing the pool). The roof top lounge is sophisticated, laid back, with amazing views of the Bosphorus and the Asian side. The location of the hotel in the neighbourhood of Besiktas is not convenient to the main sites in Sultanahmet but I did find a way around this without spending a fortune on taxis (about 15TL). You can take a taxi (about 5-6TL) to Kabatas tram station (this is where Dolmabahce Palace is also located) which has the excellent tram line to take you right into Sultahnamet (about a 15 minute ride - 1.40TL fare one way), as well, there is the Metro/subway station and funicular to Taksim at this terminal. Someone else told me about taking the shared buses from near the port area (about 5-7 min walk from the hotel) that goes straight to Taksim for 1.40 TL. I thought I also saw these mini-buses waiting right at the bottom of the street where the hotel is located (verify with the hotel concierge). The hotel is also only a 10 min taxi ride (about 6-7 TL) to the lively neighbourhood of Ortakoy. So while, the hotel is not in the most convenient location, it is considered partly in the suburbs of Istanbul and you are mingling with the locals. In between the chain restaurants of McDonalds/Burger King/Pizza Hut near the hotel, there are a few Turkish cuisine places to eat (budget to high range).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: windjammer08
Reviews.Content: I must say, I got mixed reviews when I checked this hotel out on trip advisor but needless to say that myself and my boyfriend enjoyed our stay thoroughly. We couldn't fault the hotel or the service we got, though one downside was that we didn't get everything we wanted for in room dining breakfast yesterday morning, but it was cheaper so can't complain! The restaurants, like every hotel, was expensive but we moved about the different ones and spent our last meal at monet. I had requested a king room but we got a twin and it wasn''t a city view like it was meant to be, however, the beds were comfy and we were very happy and very relaxed. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the conrad crown.”
Reviews.Author: Cal100
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th floor. Great view. great food. they do shut down the bar and food right at the designated hour. we were a couple mins late and everything was gone. taking the metro to the golden horn is very easy. I recommend buying an Akbill to make it very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room quality for a five stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weltreisender09
Reviews.Content: Location and hotel itself is good; staff is very friendly and helpful, breakfast is excellent. The quality of the standard rooms does not correspond with a five stars hotel. The rooms need urgently to be refurbished (especially the bathrooms).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, poor location.”
Reviews.Author: Rambling_Canuck
Reviews.Content: This really is a beautiful hotel. It is a large American-style hotel that is beautifully decorated. Staff is very friendly, professional and accommodating. Breakfasts are wonderful. My room was very nice. Bed was comfortable and bathroom really nice. There is a great gym and pool area. Unfortunately my room did not face the Bosporus, which I suspect would have been fantastic, particularly the higher up you get. So all in all this is a beautiful hotel with potentially fantastic views, and I would normally be tempted to give it a 5 out of 5, but the location makes me want to give it a 3, so I've settled on 4. The hotel is located in Besiktas, which means that if you want to get to the tourist areas (Sultanahmet and Taksim) you are obliged to take public transportation, which is either a taxi all the way, or a taxi to Kabatas (from where there is a quick and efficient tram to the heart of the city, or a funicular up to Taksim). It is not just the cost (which isn't a lot, although taxis may start to add up) but it is the time. Traffic can be bad and you can be stuck there with everybody else. The alternative 20 minute walk to Kabatas isn't particularly interesting. There is no such thing as a quick dash back to the hotel to drop off a bag or get a jacket. I stayed here for 5 nights and guess I got used to the back and forth, but I wouldn't stay here again for that reason. It is for these reasons that I would not recommend this hotel if one is traveling to Istanbul as a tourist. If you're there on business, only then would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, beautiful views, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: envirochk
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Istanbul is truly a lovely hotel, one whose staff understands how to provide the highest level of service to its guests. The executive floor amenities were beyond compare. The lounge and balcony were a perfect location to enjoy breakfast or an evening cocktail. The children loved the pool and park across the street. The staff were the best. When my wallet was stolen in the bazaar, the team provided me a phone and support to call the credit card companies back in United States. In addtion, when the wallet was recovered by the police, the hotel provided me a bilingual escort to accompany me to the station. This hotel has the best views in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but am not sure about the location”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was push and luxurious. I loved the comfy bed and the excellent gym in the morning. The gym has a separate cardio and weight rooms but the cardio room is a bit hot and not cool enough. The hotel is big and very American looking.
