With a big staircase in the centre of lobby and a very big restaurant with view. I missed the breakfasts so no review about that. The location was off the path of what I wanted to see though. Istanbul is a big city and I guess there is no perfect location but walking out of the hotel you are not close to anything particular (not even shopping) and I was advised to take taxi to go to more happening areas. At the end I didn't end up staying late out as the taxis didn't seem very safe for a single woman. I never figured out how the public transport works. Therefore, next time I am in Istanbul, I would stay somewhere closer to the happening areas so that I can stay out and explore and get back to hotel easily. Staff were great and their command of English language was impressive. They did go out of their way to respond to my many questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but watch the phone calls!”
Reviews.Author: JandVVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently and while it was very nice as noted by others, I should note that 4 phone calls of less than 8 minutes each to North America cost almost $200 total using the hotel direct dial mode. As there was no access to the number to use my calling card this was the only option inside the hotel. I thought this was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Conrad”
Reviews.Author: tired-bus-raveller
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, we stayed on the business floor where the service was instant, really impressed. It has a lovely rooftop terrace / bar overlooking the bosphorous. Nice pool area too

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Istanbul,the 5 stars hotel in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClementCourtry
Reviews.Content: Excellent 5 stars hotel in the heart of Besiktas district A nice bar on the top floor with a beautiful view from Istanbul,with a nice selection of "finger food",and cocktails+soft drinks Definitely a nice place to stay for a business traveller,or a family holidays. Me and my brother had breakfast every morning in the restaurant on the ground floor,a huge selection of fruits,cereals,pastries....and an attentive warm 5 stars service,really top quality. We use the pool as well,a bit small for this kind of hotel,and the steam room was small too,but it was not busy at this time of the year. The front desk team make all their efforts to help them with my brother's credit card problem,young team and good concierge and porter. To finish,this stay have been wonderful for 4 days break in the beautiful city of Istanbul,and again thanks for all the team who makes our stay relaxing.ClÃ©ment from FRANCE

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat shoddy for a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: rakiraki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights a conference. My room was big, very comfortable and had a nice view. However the decor was pretty old and the walls were noticeably dirty. Also the floor I was on was clearly half way through being renovated and was full of rolled up carpets, paint flakes, half-stripped rooms with their doors off and so on. You'd think a Conrad would close the floor off to guests until it was finished. Apart from those issues I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: WePeregrinate
Reviews.Content: A competent hotel and what you would expect from a Conrad. Location is walking distance to the Bosphorus (Besiktas station) and the Dolmabahce Palace (20 mins walk). Must take a taxi for other sights. The most outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. I can't remember the name of the front desk staff who helped, but it sounded like Picic or Picpic. He helped us when my camera conked out in the middle of the trip. Since we don't speak or read Turkish, he searched on the internet for stores selling professional cameras in Istanbul. Then he called the store to check if the camera was in stock and asked the price. He wrote down all the info on paper for us to take. As we were leaving we happened to mention that the price was a little higher than what we paid in the U.S. but that it was to be expected. He got right back on the phone and - get this - bargained the price down and got the name of the person he spoke with. He wrote everything down again. It was a nice effort and was entertaining to watch. He must have spent half an hour helping us.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel on business and was on the executive floor. I agree with reviewers who commented on the staff at the hotel, everyone I spoke to was friendly and helpful. Overall, I do think the hotel is a little tired, and I did think the bathroom was pretty poky! I would recommend a drink in the bar on the 14th floor - lovely views of the city. I wouldn't agree that this is a 5 star hotel compared to other properties in Istanbul, but I would stay there again if I needed to. Make sure that the taxi driver knows exactly which Hilton you are staying in - there are 3 in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars for the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: TAC1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad Hotel Istanbul for three nights in late August 2008. We rank it five stars. The facility is modern, clean and towers over the hill it is built on. The front desk staff was very helpful and let us check in early after a long overnight flight. The room was good size, tastefully furnished and had a view of the Bosphorus - which I highly recommend. The hotel had extra security for vehicles entering the facility - I'm sure as a result of the latest violence in the city. The hotel is located across town from most of the tourist sites. Cab fare to these sites is about YTL 15. (The hotel cabs are honest. Almost every other cab in town will change his meter to night rate (2x) , not use the meter and ask for an exhorbant amount when it 's time to pay, perform a slight of hand when your paying them and insist you didn't give them what you KNOW you paid them - or all three!) Last - the Conrad is close to some great seafood restaurants and the ferrys to Asia. Great hotel - enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Horizon360
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located 5 minutes walk from the Bosphorus (where boat trips can be taken at very affordable fare), but also along a large boulevard that led to probably the best shopping centres. I stayed at the Conrad for a getaway with my wife and booked the Executive Floor. The access to the Club Lounge was just fabulous, friendly staff and great selection of food and drink treats all day long, whithout forgetting the terrace and its stunning view on the Bosphorus. We also tried the Italian restaurant, which was very tasty and genuine. The fitness area looks sharp... all cardio equipement has individual TV screen, quite a good alternative to the usual IPOD! The bedroom was contemporary in style and well maintanined, and was featuring all modern amenities one would expect (Nespresso machine, LCD screen etc.) When visiting the old city, we got the advise of the concierge to try the tram as an alrernative transportation, which was direct and easy to use and brought us to Topkapi Palace within 20 minutes. Generally speaking, we found the staff and the locals very welcoming and helpful. We will definitively be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplars of Hospitality and Grace”
Reviews.Author: RumiFriend
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 weeks in Istanbul completing a very demanding work assignment. My helpful employer had initially placed me in a pleasant but standard 5 star hotel also conveniently located in Istanbul. In a world class city that offers an amazing range of hotel choices, I decided to move hotels when my family came to join me for the last weeks of my work assignment. I report that the Conrad Istanbul, part of the Hilton family of hotels, far exceeded any expectations, not only for its physical beauty and breathtaking vistas overlooking the Bospherous, but most of all for the very high quality and graceful personal presence of its hard-working employees at all levels of the hotel. My family (including the teenagers who are not easily impressed) especially appreciated the personalized attention offered to us by the exemplary sales and concierage services of Conrad Istanbul, but it is also true that every employee, from the friendly fitness room staff (in the lower lobby) to the very enjoyable hostesses/hosts & waiters in the restaurant/lounges in the lobby and the 14-15th floors, to the door and bell men and all the less-seen staff who managed our rooms all displayed a personal pleasantness that is not simply the outcome of a general public relations training but reflects the high quality of the individuals employed by Conrad Istanbul and their attitudes toward the true meanings of hospitality. We appreciated our visit to Conrad Istanbul more than we can say, and we recommend that visitors consider its very safe and beautifully-situated location in Besiktas district during your next visit to multiply layered magnificence that is Istanbul. (Walk out the hotel door to the bottom of Barberos, 5 minutes down hill, and take a sea-ferry across the shimmering strait to the Asian side of this great city, parallell to the continent spanning Bospherous Bridge, & look back over your shoulder and see the rise-up of your hotel, the Conrad Istanbul...)Tesekkur Ederim, thank you very much to Conrad, I hope we will meet again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: towercrane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a getaway break not long ago. The hotel was in a great position and we were booked onto the club floor which was wonderful. The service and attention of the staff made our stay even more enjoyable. The room was comfortable and every day they bought different complimentary items. I would certainly recommend this hotel as we were made to feel very welcome and everyone was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the Conrad Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RobertAtlantan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Greece, the Greek Isles, Turkey and Egypt - and we can honestly say that Istanbul was the high point! We stayed on the Executive Level at the Conrad Hotel and found the amenities and hospitality outstanding. Loved the restaurants at the Conrad. The food was excellent and I really loved Efes Beer (the light one). Our room had a glorious view of the Bosphorus and the old city - not to be missed. Jean-Sebastian Kling, the manager of the hotel, has done an excellent job of making this hotel a great place to stay for business or pleasure. In addition, the Guest Services Manager, Oslan, is worth her weight in gold. Service and cleanliness were excellent throughout the hotel. We slept like babies in the comfortable King-size bed. What an incredible city and what an incredible country! We toured Ephesus before flying from Izmir to Istanbul. After visiting the ruins at Athens and Delphi (Greece), we were astounded by the large land area excavated at Ephesus (Turkey). I would rank Istanbul equal to London or Rome in terms of historic areas and tourist interest - and while not quite equal to Paris in overall impression, the incredible location at the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus makes Istanbul superior in terms of natural beauty to most other cities we have visited in Europe and Asia. I have attached a photo that I received as a courtesy from Manager Mr. Kling, after meeting him at the Summit Bar. It was taken from the Summit's terrace. The executive level upgrade is obviously worth opting for at this hotel. I can't wait to make an extended visit to Turkey. The people there were among the friendliest and most cosmopolitan we have met anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “getting greedy...”
Reviews.Author: mangolust
Reviews.Content: I stay here fairly frequently and my company enjoys a decent corporate rate. I'm usually allocated an Exec room on the 14th floor and when the weather allows, enjoy breakfasting with one of the best views in the city as a backdrop. I find the rooms large and clean; the beds comfortable, the pillows capable of smothering the unwary and the staff polite and attentive. In the past I've noted the non-exec rooms to be tired and a bit shabby, but on my most recent visit I stayed in a 10th floor room which, I was gratified to note, had benefitted from a recent makeover. I was outraged, however, at the 27Euro/24hr Internet rate provided by Swisscom, which used to be free on the exec floors. Unlike other reviewers, I like BeÅŸiktaÅŸ as a location - approximately the same taxi time/midpoint between Bebek and Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service at Conrad”
Reviews.Author: posty22
Reviews.Content: I spent several days at Conrad Istanbul and had a fabulous experience! I had a room that over looked the bridge and the Bosphorous, we had a wonderful dinner at Prego - and with my husband enjoyed several nights sitting in the Summit enjoying outstanding views, service and great vibe! Strongly recommend this hotel and recommend the concierge to assist you as he was great at creating several private tours for us around Istanbul! Thanks to all that made our trip so amazing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Welshrarebit2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for a few days to allow me to spend some time exploring Istanbul and couldn't fault it. On arrival I was welcomed by the friendly reception staff and assisted by the concierge who couldn't do enough for me. The room I was allocated was large, beautifully decorated and immaculately seviced everyday. It was also a real bonus to open the curtains of a morning to the amazing views across the Bosphorus. The food available at breakfast was both varied and delicious and the waiting staff attentive to my needs - always on hand to recommend dishes or top up on coffee! As a lone traveller it also made a real difference that the staff were always friendly, approachable and took the time to make conversation with me. Getting recommendations from them about where to go and what to see really helped me fit everything into my short visit - notably my morning at a turkish bath, an experience I won't forget! It was great to find that the town was only a short walk away with the Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque close by too. All in all I had a fabulous stay at the Conrad and wouldn't hesitate in returning or recommending it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The best views in the city”
Reviews.Author: LouiseAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: This was not my first trip to Istanbul but my first time at the Conrad Hotel. Being greeted by the doormen and concierge was a good start and was welcome after my delayed flight. The rooms on the Business floor are very nice and it is definitely worth opting for a Bosphorus view room as this was a real highlight of the hotel. Situated on top of a hill the views of the city are magnificent, but the best spot in town is their Summit Bar on the top floor overlooking the Bosphorus and the Asian side of the city. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay. I found the staff courteous and helpful and, having eaten in their Italian restaurant on the first evening, I thought it excellent that the chef came out to speak to us and discuss them menu etc. On top of that the food was excellent! I would certainly return to the hotel if I get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “top business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwolfsthal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on business. Clean, classy and comfortable. The staff are exceedingly polite and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. The pool is awesome, but the gym needs updating. The top floor bar has an amazing view. All in all, a good experience. The location is not THE most central, but the hotel service and style are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Is this a 5 Star Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: LetsgoKnicks
Reviews.Content: Ohh my God,,,I never seen in my life Hotel General Manager yelling his Staff. Checking in and out was very ruff. Until 8 floor ,you have to pay for dialup service for internet. And Construction noise... Ohh my God...Dont stay here....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwy424
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really impressive. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff is very knowledgable and helpful. The rooms are well appointed and spacious, with very comfortable beds. Breakfast is fantastic, though the service is a bit slow. The Summit Bar on the 14th floor has a wonderful view, and you pay for it in the drink prices. The location is good, with taxis plentiful and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - no complaint”
Reviews.Author: scl1003
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 nights for business and it got everything I need....the breakfast is great, the concierge very helpful (good English too). Very reliable hi-spped wireless internet, which is most helpful. The front desk was v helpful...provided the travel adepter that I needed. The TV was a bit small for a hotel like this, as someone already pointed out. I got it for 120 something US + tax so didn't expect much from the room (looking to the inside of the S-shape so no view at all), can't have breakfast from the beautiful terrace. My colleague booked herself at the higher floors that has access to the terrace ...for 210 US I guess.

Reviews.Title: “A once-in-a-lifetime experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jill7394u48
Reviews.Content: And why? I can safely say that I will never stay there again. The Conrad is in the middle of nowhere. I was there for business and it was miles from the Congress venue. Taxis are best avoided in Istambul, but then again, so is everything else. I almost got killed in one. About the hotel, it could definitely use a serious refurbishing. The drapes were dirty and dusty. The beds and bathroom were clean, but definitely not 5 star quality. The downstairs breakfast was plentiful and relatively pleasant.. The quality of the staff left a lot to be desired, especially at the business center. Throughout, I felt like they were going through my purse and they really were. The whole city is a ripoff. I got ripped off everywhere. Taxi drivers are known for not returning change.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Conrad in Istanbul, TR”
Reviews.Author: RhondaTW
Reviews.Content: I'll try to be brief...on a tour of Turkey with Insight Tours (16 days). 1) There is a 20 minute check-in - you go through a metal detector and put your bags through the machine...we had to line up (40 people on the tour) - no group sign-in as at the other 5 star hotels in Turkey...individual sign-ins - required to give a credit card or cash deposit -- only hotel on tour to require this. It is the custom throughout Turkey to provide the service and then request payment...the Conrad treats it's guests like petty thieves that would leave without paying the mini bar bill. 2) my room was directly in front of the satellite dishes, must have been the worst room in the hotel...If I strained my neck I could see the sea behind the satellite dishes...I could hear street traffic and the neighbors who lived just a few feet away from the hotel...also the children staying in a room two doors down (sound proofing can't be that expensive) 3) no towels in the bathroom...none at all. 4) the iron and ironing board I requested were older than me...the iron was taped together and had frayed wires...They should be ashamed to even have something so tacky in the hotel, much less deliver it to a guest. 5) my phone did not work and I had to go to reception twice: once to ask for towels and since they hadn't fixed the phone by bedtime, I had to go again to ask for the iron and ironing board 6) group wake up call was an hour early 7) another guest didn't have a safe in the room 8) they charge 10 turkish lirya for regular coffee 9) no turkish bath...only hotel on tour without one We stayed at two Hiltons, a Sheraton and other 5 star hotels....the Conrad is not a 5 star hotel. You have been forewarned. A Weary Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Nothing dramatically bad, just elow par for a top hotel elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MarcoSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: I am a HHonors member and stay at their hotels frequently. While there was nothing dramatic or poorly done in the hotel, it doesn't have the features that I have come to expect at the top Hilton hotels. They are in the process of refurbishing the rooms so some look a bit dated while the newer ones have a nice clean look. I stayed in a newer room on the 10th floor which was modest in size but not uncomfortably small. The bathrooms are acceptable but certainly not exceptional. The tub is standard as opposed to the large soaking tubs that are found in their other properties. There is no WiFi in the hotel and only the newer rooms have the wired broadband access. Connection speed was slow and unacceptable for video conferencing. It didn't support VPN connections but I'm uncertain whether this is a Hilton issue. The TV was in the 19-22" size which again is modest for this class of hotel. There was a good collection of multilingual channels (42 active channels including local, Japanese, German, Italian, and English) The Terrace on 14 and 15 gives lovely views over the city and the Bosphorus. Garden views are looking at another building, there is no garden. Water views are great. Summary: Nothing bad but it seemed much more akin to a standard Hilton rather than one of their premier properties. If you get a great deal it is fine but probably not the treat that you might expect.
